share as of June 30, 2005, the aggregate market value of the voting and
non-voting common equity of the Registrant held by non-affiliates was
approximately $421.3 million.</font></p>

  March 9, 2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Documents Incorporated by Reference - Portions
of our definitive Proxy Statement relating to our 2006 Annual Meeting of
Shareholders are incorporated by reference into Part III of this Form 10-K.&#160; We anticipate that our Proxy Statement will
be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission within 120 days after the
end of our fiscal year ended December 31, 2005.&#160;&#160; </font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS</font></b></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This report includes or
incorporates forward-looking statements within the meaning of the U.S. Private
Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&#160;
We have based these forward-looking statements on our current
expectations and projections about future events.&#160; These forward-looking statements are subject
to risks, uncertainties and assumptions about us, including, among other
things, the following risks:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General risks</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
impact of changes in national and regional economies;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>terrorist acts of violence or war and
other geopolitical events;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the activities of our competitors;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Industry risks</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the business conditions of our
advertisers;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competition with other broadcast
television stations, radio stations, satellite television providers, internet
content providers, cable system operators and telecommunication providers
serving in the same markets;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>availability and cost of programming;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the effects of governmental
regulation of broadcasting or changes in those regulations and court actions
interpreting those regulations, including ownership regulations, indecency
regulations, political advertising restrictions and regulations regarding the
transition from analog to digital over-the-air broadcasting;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the timely transition of digital
television over analog by the viewing public;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the continued viability of networks
and syndicators that provide us with programming content;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Risks specific to
Sinclair Broadcast Group</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the effectiveness of our management;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>our ability to attract and maintain
local and national advertising;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the popularity of syndicated
programming we purchase and network programming that we air;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the strength of ratings for our news
broadcasts;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>our ability to service our
outstanding debt;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changes in the makeup of the
population in the areas where our stations are located;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changes in local regulations in the
areas where our stations are located;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>successful integration of outsourcing
agreements;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>our ability to maintain our
affiliation agreements with the relevant networks; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>FCC license renewals.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other matters set forth
in this report, including the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Risk Factors</font></i>
set forth in Item 1A of this report and/or in the documents incorporated by
reference, may also cause actual results in the future to differ materially
from those described in the forward-looking statements.&#160; We undertake no obligation to update or
revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information,
future events or otherwise.&#160; In light of
these risks, uncertainties and assumptions, the forward-looking statements
discussed in this report might not occur.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="PartI_110430"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART I</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><a name="Item1_Business_110426"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM
1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; BUSINESS</font></b></h2>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a diversified
television broadcasting company that owns or provides certain programming,
operating or sales services to more television stations than any other
commercial broadcasting group in the United States.&#160; We currently own, provide programming and operating
services pursuant to local marketing agreements (LMAs) or provide (or are
provided) sales services pursuant to outsourcing agreements to 58 television
stations in 36 markets.&#160; For the purpose
of this report, these 58 stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148; stations.&#160; We currently have 11 duopoly markets where we
own and operate at least two stations within the same market.&#160; We have nine LMA markets where, with one
exception, we own and operate one station in the market and provide programming
and operating services to, or by, another station within that market.&#160; In the remaining 16 markets, we own and
operate a single television station.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a mid-size market
focus and 44 of our 58 stations are located in television designated markets
areas (DMAs) that rank between the 12<sup>th</sup> and 75<sup>th</sup> largest in
the United States.&#160; Our television
station group is diverse in network affiliation with 19 stations affiliated
with FOX, 18 with WB, 10 with ABC, six with UPN, two with CBS and one with NBC.&#160; Two of our stations are not affiliated with
any network.&#160; In the fall of 2006, our
composition of network affiliates will change as a result of our recent
agreement to air MyNetworkTV programming and the recent announcements about the
merger of UPN and The WB into a network to be called The CW Television Network
(The CW).&#160; Refer to our <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Markets and Stations </font></i>table on page 5 and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 18. Subsequent Events, </font></i>in the Notes to our Consolidated
Financial Statements for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We broadcast free
over-the-air programming to television viewing audiences in the communities we
serve through our local television stations.&#160;
The programming that we provide consists of network provided programs,
news produced locally, syndicated local sporting events and syndicated
entertainment programs.&#160; We provide
network produced programming which we broadcast pursuant to our agreements with
the network with which the stations are affiliated.&#160; We produce news at 26 stations in 23 markets and
six stations have a local news sharing arrangement with a competitive station
in that market.&#160; We provide live local
sporting events on many of our stations by acquiring the local television
broadcast rights for these events.&#160;
Additionally, we purchase and barter for popular syndicated programming
from third parties.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Operating Strategy</font></i> later in this Item for
more information regarding the programming we provide.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary source of
revenue is the sale of commercial inventory on our television stations to our
advertising customers.&#160; Our objective is
to meet the needs of our advertising customers by delivering significant
audiences in key demographics.&#160; Our
strategy is to achieve this objective by providing quality local news
programming and popular network and syndicated programs to our viewing audience.&#160; We attract our national television advertisers
through a single national marketing representation firm with offices in the
major advertising agency markets of New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago and
Atlanta.&#160; Our local television
advertisers are attracted through the strong local sales force at each of our
television stations, which is comprised of approximately 550 account executives
company-wide.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are
subject to seasonal fluctuations.&#160; The
fourth quarter operating results are typically higher than the first and third
quarters primarily because advertising expenditures are increased in
anticipation of holiday season spending by consumers.&#160; The second quarter operating results are also
higher than the first and third quarters primarily because advertising
expenditures are increased in anticipation of consumer spending on &#147;summer
related&#148; items such as home improvements, lawn care and travel plans.&#160; Our operating results are usually subject to
cyclical fluctuations from political advertising.&#160; In even-numbered years, political spending is
significantly higher than in odd-numbered years due to advertising expenditures
preceding local and national elections.&#160;
Additionally, every four years, political spending is elevated further
due to advertising expenditures preceding the presidential election.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We seek to own, operate
or engage in operating service agreements with multiple television stations in
the markets we serve in order to increase revenues, reduce expenses and improve
margins through increased economies of scale.&#160;
We have entered into LMAs in eight markets where, for a variety of
reasons, we do not own the broadcast license related to the second
station.&#160; In addition, in one market we
operate only one station under an LMA for which we do not own the broadcast
license.&#160; Under LMAs, we provide
substantial portions of the broadcast programming and sell advertising time
during such programming segments for that second station.&#160; Our strategy for attracting viewers and
advertisers for our LMA television stations is essentially the same as for our
owned and operated television stations.&#160;
In order to improve our margins, we have entered into outsourcing
agreements in four of our markets in which our stations are provided, or
provide, various non-programming related services such as sales, operational
and managerial services to or by other stations.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Operating
Strategy</font></i> later in this Item for more information regarding our LMAs,
duopolies and outsourcing agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a Maryland
corporation formed in 1986.&#160; Our
principal offices are located at 10706 Beaver Dam Road, Hunt Valley, Maryland
21030.&#160; Our telephone number is (410)
568-1500 and our website address is www.sbgi.net.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TELEVISION BROADCASTING</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Markets and Stations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We own and operate,
provide programming services to, provide sales services to or have agreed to
acquire the following television stations:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\skannan\06-1921-1\task931277\1921-1-ba-01.htm',USER='skannan',CD='Mar 16 21:15 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Rankings
are based on the relative size of a station&#146;s designated market area (DMA)
among the 210 generally recognized DMAs in the United States as estimated by
Nielsen as of November 2005.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;O
&amp; O&#148; refers to stations that we own and operate.&#160; &#147;LMA&#148; refers to stations to which we provide
programming services pursuant to a local marketing agreement.&#160; &#147;OSA&#148; refers to stations to which we provide
sales services pursuant to an outsourcing agreement.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Channels
are shown here as Analog / Digital.&#160; Digital
channels 52-68 are subject to change prior to the cessation of analog signals
in February 2009.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Represents
the estimated number of television stations designated by Nielsen as &#147;local&#148; to
the DMA, excluding public television stations and stations that do not meet the
minimum Nielsen reporting standards (weekly cumulative audience of at least
0.1%) for the Monday-Sunday, 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 a.m. time period as of November
2005. &#160;This information is provided to us
in a summary report by Katz Television Group.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
rank of each station in its market is based upon the November 2005 Nielsen
estimates of the percentage of persons tuned into each station in the market
from 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 a.m., Monday-Sunday.&#160;
This information is provided to us in a summary report by Katz
Television Group.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
license assets for this station are currently owned by Bay TV, a related party.
&#160;See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 11.</font></i>  <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Related Party Transactions</font></i>, in the Notes to our Consolidated
Financial Statements for more information.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">g)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
January 24, 2006, CBS Corporation (CBS) and Warner Bros. Entertainment (Warner
Bros.) announced their intent in September 2006 to merge the operations of
their respective networks, UPN and The WB, under a broadcasting network to be
called The CW.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">h)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We
filed timely applications for renewal of these licenses with the FCC.&#160; These applications are currently pending.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
August 22, 2005, we, along with Cunningham and FOX Broadcasting Company (FOX)
entered into an Amendment (the &#147;Amendment&#148;) to each of the original FOX
Affiliation Agreements dated July 1, 2002 (collectively, the &#147;Agreements&#148;),
which had expired on June 30, 2005.&#160; The
Amendment was effective as of August 22, 2005.&#160;
Pursuant to the terms of the Amendment, the Agreements will continue in
full force and effect until terminated by FOX, or by us or Cunningham (as
applicable for its subsidiary stations), in such party&#146;s sole discretion.&#160; We continue to negotiate the terms of a
long-term agreement.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">j)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We
timely filed applications for renewal of these licenses with the FCC.&#160; Unrelated third parties have filed petitions to
deny or informal objections against such applications.&#160; We opposed the petitions to deny and informal
objections and those applications are currently pending.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 10.</font></i>  <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Commitments and Contingencies</font></i>, in the Notes to our
Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">k)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
license assets for these stations are currently owned by Cunningham
Broadcasting Company (&#147;Cunningham&#148;), a related party, or one of its
subsidiaries.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Federal Regulations of Television Broadcasting</font></i>
for more information.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">l)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Cunningham
timely filed applications for renewal of these stations with the FCC.&#160; These applications are currently pending.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">m)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We
have entered into an outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third party owner
of WNAB-TV to provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and
administrative services to WNAB-TV.&#160; Our
application to acquire this FCC license is pending FCC approval.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">n)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
unrelated third party licensees of these stations timely filed applications for
renewal of these licenses.&#160; These
applications are currently pending.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Cunningham
timely filed applications for renewal of these licenses with the FCC.&#160; Unrelated third parties have filed petitions
to deny such applications.&#160; Cunningham
opposed the petitions to deny and those applications are currently
pending.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 10.</font></i>
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Commitments and Contingencies</font></i>, in the
Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">p)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WDBB-TV
simulcasts the programming broadcast on WTTO-TV pursuant to a programming
services agreement.&#160; The station rank
applies to the combined viewership of these stations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">q)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;IND&#148;
or &#147;Independent&#148; refers to a station that is not affiliated with any of ABC,
CBS, NBC, FOX, WB or UPN.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">r)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>An
argument may exist that this agreement expires on August 31, 2006.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">s)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We
have entered into outsourcing agreements with unrelated third parties, under
which the unrelated third parties provide certain non-programming related
sales, operational and managerial services to these stations.&#160; We continue to own all of the assets of these
stations and to program and control each station&#146;s operations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">t)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>WICD-TV,
a satellite of WICS-TV, under FCC rules, simulcasts all of the programming
aired on WICS-TV except the news broadcasts.&#160;
The station rank applies to the combined viewership of these stations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">u)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>NBC
informed us that they intend to terminate this affiliation agreement on its
expiration date.&#160; We continue to
negotiate the terms of a new affiliation agreement with NBC.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">v)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On March 6, 2006, we entered into an agreement
with MyNetworkTV to air 12 hours of original programming content from 8:00pm to
10:00pm (EST/PST) Monday through Saturday beginning on September 5, 2006.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\skannan\06-1921-1\task931277\1921-1-ba-01.htm',USER='skannan',CD='Mar 16 21:15 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Strategy</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating strategy
includes the following elements:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Programming
to Attract Viewership</font></i>.&#160;
We seek to target our programming offerings to attract viewership, to
meet the needs of the communities in which we serve and to meet the needs of
our advertising customers.&#160; In pursuit of
this strategy, we seek to obtain, at attractive prices, popular syndicated
programming that is complementary to each station&#146;s network programming.&#160; We also seek to broadcast live local and
national sporting events that would appeal to a large segment of the local
community.&#160; Moreover, we produce news at 26
stations in 23 markets, and six stations have a local news sharing agreement
with a competitive station in that market.&#160;
Each of our newscasts includes
a daily commentary called <i><font style="font-style:italic;">The Point</font></i>,
which was recently awarded four Telly Awards for excellence.&#160; The Telly Awards is a widely known and highly
respected national and international competition, and is the premier award
honoring outstanding local, regional and cable TV commercials and programs, as
well as the finest video and film productions.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing
Local Franchises</font></i>.&#160; We
believe the greatest opportunity for a sustainable and growing customer base
lies within our local communities.&#160;
Therefore, we have focused on developing a strong local sales force at
each of our television stations, which is comprised of approximately 550
account executives company-wide.&#160;
Excluding political advertising revenue, 61.6% of our time sales were
local for the year ended December 31, 2005, up from 62.7% in 2004.&#160; Our goal is to continue to grow our local
revenues by increasing our market share and by developing new business
opportunities.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing
New Business</font></i>.&#160; We are
always striving to develop new business models to complement or enhance our
existing television broadcast business.&#160;
During the past few years, we have built a profitable direct mail
business at many of our stations using, for the most part, our existing sales
force.&#160; As we continue to improve the
profit margins from this business, we plan to develop other initiatives beginning
in 2006 that will give us additional competitive advantage.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One of these initiatives
is multi-channel digital broadcasting.&#160;
Our digital channel capacity will allow us to broadcast multiple additional
channels, in addition to our current broadcast channel, for each FCC license we
own.&#160; In May 2006, we are launching
WBFF-2 in Baltimore, Maryland as a new digital channel that will air nostalgic
syndicated programming that will appeal to a niche market that is not currently
being served.&#160; This additional channel
will use the same broadcasting infrastructure as WBFF-TV, our main channel in
Baltimore, and our existing sales force, both of which should enable us to
become profitable in the first year of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Another initiative is
production and airing of <i><font style="font-style:italic;">A Better Life</font></i>,
a self-improvement program, in many of our markets.&#160; This type of programming appeals to a wide
array of viewers, which makes it appealing to advertisers that haven&#146;t
traditionally focused on television advertising.&#160; Our first series of <i><font style="font-style:italic;">A Better
Life</font></i> has resulted in advertising committments of approximately $2.5
million to date, and we expect to continue producing this program and other
similar programming, going forward.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Monetizing
Retransmission Agreements</font></i>.&#160;
As the competition for programming content increases among the many
cable, satellite and telecommunications companies, we are in a position to
realize significant additional revenues.&#160;
We have retransmission agreements with many cable and satellite
operators in our markets.&#160; Previously,
these agreements have allowed these cable and satellite companies to air our
programming to their subscribers without reimbursing us for this content.&#160; We believe that these companies should
reimburse us for our digital signal, and as such, as these agreements come up
for renewal, we are including terms which provide us with retransmission fee
revenues.&#160; Additionally, as the major
telecommunications companies develop their infrastructure to deliver
programming content to television sets, cell phones and other hand-held
devices, we will be able to generate additional retransmission fees through
agreements with them for our digital signal.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Control
of Operating and Programming Costs</font></i>.&#160; By employing a disciplined approach to
managing programming acquisition and other costs, we have been able to achieve
operating margins that we believe are very competitive within the television
broadcast industry.&#160; We believe our
national reach of approximately 22% of the country provides us with a strong
position to negotiate with programming providers, and, as a result, the
opportunity to purchase high quality programming at more favorable prices.&#160; Moreover, we emphasize control of each of our
station&#146;s programming and operating costs through program-specific profit
analysis, detailed budgeting, regionalization of staff and detailed long-term
planning models.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Ownership
Duopolies and Utilization of Local Marketing Agreements</font></i>.&#160; We have sought to increase our revenues and
improve our margins through the ownership of two stations in a single market,
called a duopoly, and by providing programming services pursuant to an LMA to a
second station in eight DMAs where we already own one station.&#160; Duopolies and LMAs allow us to realize
significant economies of scale in marketing, programming, overhead and capital
expenditures.&#160; We also believe these
arrangements enable us to air popular programming and contribute to the
diversity of programming within each DMA.&#160;
Although under the FCC ownership rules released in June 2003, we would
be allowed to continue to program most of the stations with which we have an
LMA, in the absence of a waiver, the 2003 rules would require us to terminate
or modify three of our LMAs.&#160; Although
there can be no assurances, we have studied the application of the 2003 rules
to our markets and believe we are qualified for waivers.&#160; For additional information,</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\skannan\06-1921-1\task931277\1921-1-ba-01.htm',USER='skannan',CD='Mar 16 21:15 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">refer to <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Risk Factors - Changes in
Rules on Television Ownership</font></i>, and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Risk
Factors - The FCC&#146;s multiple ownership rules limit our ability to operate
multiple television stations in some markets and may result in a reduction in
our revenue or prevent us from reducing costs.&#160;
Changes in these rules may threaten our existing strategic approach to
certain television markets</font></i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use
of Outsourcing Agreements</font></i>.&#160;
In addition to our LMAs, we currently operate under four (and may seek
opportunities for additional) outsourcing agreements in which our stations
provide or are provided various non-programming related services such as sales,
operational and managerial services to or by other stations.&#160; Pursuant to these agreements, our stations in
Nashville, Tennessee currently provides services to another station in the
market and other parties provide services to our stations in
Peoria/Bloomington, Illinois, Cedar Rapids, Iowa and Rochester, New York.&#160; As a result of a change in ownership of the unrelated
third-party, we terminated our outsourcing agreement in Tallahassee, Florida on
February 19, 2006.&#160; We believe this
structure allows stations to achieve operational efficiencies and economies of
scale, which should otherwise improve broadcast cash flow and competitive
positions.&#160; While television joint sales
agreements (JSAs) are not currently attributable, as that term is defined by
the FCC, on August 2, 2004, the FCC released a notice of proposed rulemaking
seeking comments on its tentative conclusion that television joint sales
agreements should be attributable.&#160; We
cannot predict the outcome of this proceeding, nor can we predict how any
changes, together with possible changes to the ownership rules, would apply to
our existing outsourcing agreements.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Strategic
Realignment of Station Portfolio</font></i>.&#160; We continue to examine our television station
group portfolio in light of the FCC&#146;s broadcast ownership rules adopted in
2003.&#160; For a summary of these rules,
refer to <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Ownership Matters,</font></i> discussed in the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Federal Regulation of Television Broadcasting</font></i>.&#160; Our objective is to build our local
franchises in the markets we deem strategic.&#160;
We routinely review and conduct investigations of potential television
station acquisitions, dispositions and station swaps.&#160; At any given time, we may be in discussions
with one or more television station owners.&#160;
For more information related to station sales, see <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 12.
Discontinued Operations</font></i>, in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial
Statements.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November 15, 1999, we
entered into a plan and agreement of merger to acquire through merger WBSC-TV
(formerly WFBC-TV) in Anderson, South Carolina from Cunningham Broadcasting
Corporation (Cunningham), but that transaction was denied by the FCC.&#160; In light of the change in the 2003 ownership
rules, we have filed a petition for reconsideration with the FCC and amended
our application to acquire the license of WBSC-TV.&#160; We also filed applications in November 2003
to acquire the license assets of the remaining five Cunningham stations:
WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio; WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WVAH-TV,
Charleston, West Virginia; WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland; and WTTE-TV, Columbus,
Ohio.&#160; The Rainbow/PUSH Coalition
(Rainbow/PUSH) filed a petition to deny these five applications and to revoke
all of our licenses.&#160; The FCC dismissed
our applications in light of the stay of the 2003 ownership rules and also
denied the Rainbow/PUSH petition.&#160;
Rainbow/PUSH filed a petition for reconsideration of that denial and we
filed an application for review of the dismissal, which may be impacted by the
remand of the FCC&#146;s 2003 ownership rules.&#160;
In 2005, we filed a petition with the U. S. Court of Appeals for the
D.C. Circuit requesting that the Court direct the FCC to take final action on
our applications, but that petition was dismissed.&#160; On January 6, 2006, we submitted a motion to
the FCC requesting that it take final action on our applications.&#160; Both the applications and the associated
petition to deny are still pending.&#160; We
believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition is without merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July 21, 2005, we
filed with the FCC an application to acquire WNAB-TV in Nashville,
Tennessee.&#160; Rainbow/PUSH filed a petition
to deny that application and also requested that the FCC initiate a hearing to
investigate whether WNAB was improperly operated with WZTV-TV and WUXP-TV, two
of our stations located in the same market as WNAB.&#160; That proceeding is currently pending and we
believe the petition had no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At this time, there can
be no assurance that any of these transactions will be completed.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Risk
Factors - The FCC&#146;s multiple ownership rules limit our ability to operate
multiple television stations and may result in a reduction on our revenue or
prevent us from reducing costs.&#160; Changes
in these rules may threaten our existing strategy approach to certain
television markets</font></i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Local
News</font></i>.&#160; We believe that
the production and broadcasting of local news is an important link to the community
and an aid to a station&#146;s efforts to expand its viewership.&#160; In addition, local news programming can
provide access to advertising sources targeted specifically to local news
viewers.&#160; We assess the anticipated
benefits and costs of producing local news prior to introduction at our
stations because a significant investment in capital equipment is required and
substantial operating expenses are incurred in introducing, developing and
producing local news programming.&#160; We
also continuously review the performance of our existing news operations to
make sure they are economically viable.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\skannan\06-1921-1\task931277\1921-1-ba-01.htm',USER='skannan',CD='Mar 16 21:15 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Popular
Sporting Events</font></i>.&#160; Our
WB and UPN affiliated and independent stations generally face fewer
restrictions on broadcasting live local sporting events compared with FOX, ABC,
CBS and NBC affiliates, which are required to broadcast a greater number of
hours of programming supplied by the networks.&#160;
At some of our stations, we have been able to acquire local television broadcast
rights for certain sporting events, including NBA basketball, Major League
Baseball, NFL football, NHL hockey, ACC basketball and both Big Ten and SEC
football and basketball.&#160; We seek to
expand our sports broadcasting in DMAs only as profitable opportunities
arise.&#160; In addition, our stations that
are affiliated with FOX, ABC, CBS and NBC broadcast certain Major League
Baseball games, NFL football games, NHL hockey games and NASCAR races, as well
as other popular sporting events.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Attract
and Retain High Quality Management</font></i>.&#160; We believe that much of our success is due to
our ability to attract and retain highly skilled and motivated managers at both
the corporate and local station levels.&#160;
A significant portion of the compensation available to our Chief
Operating Officer, sales vice presidents, group managers, general managers,
sales managers and other station managers is based on their exceeding certain
operating results.&#160; We also provide some
of our corporate and station managers with deferred compensation plans.&#160; Annually, managers at our stations and certain
of our corporate officers are eligible for bonuses tied to performance at the
discretion of the Compensation Committee (which is comprised of certain members
of the Board of Directors).</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Community
Involvement</font></i>. Each of our stations actively participates in
various community activities and offers many community services.&#160; Our activities include broadcast programming
of local interest and sponsorship of community and charitable events.&#160; We also encourage our station employees to
become active members of their communities and to promote involvement in
community and charitable affairs.&#160; After
Hurricane Ivan affected their community, WEAR-TV in Pensacola, Florida compiled
their news footage of the hurricane into a DVD entitled &#147;In Focus: Hurricane
Ivan Special.&#148;&#160; Approximately $180,000 of
the proceeds from the sale of the DVDs was donated to various charities
including Habitat for Humanity and United Way.&#160;
In response to the Tsunami tragedy in Southeast Asia during 2004, our
employees generously donated over $17,000; we matched this amount with a
contribution to the American Red Cross.&#160; In
response to the disaster caused by Hurricane Katrina, the Sinclair Relief Fund
(the Fund) was formed by David D. Smith, Frederick Smith, J. Duncan Smith, each
controlling shareholders, and Barry M. Faber, our Vice President and General
Counsel.&#160; The Fund is a qualified
charitable organization formed to provide monetary aid and relief to the
victims of natural disasters.&#160; Our
employees and viewers generously donated over $208,000 to the Fund and we made
an additional contribution of $50,000.&#160;
The Fund distributed the contributions to various organizations
including the American Red Cross, the Salvation Army, Feed the Children and USA
Harvest.&#160; We believe that active
community involvement by our stations provides our stations with increased
exposure in their respective DMAs and is our responsibility as stewards of the
community&#146;s broadcast license.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FEDERAL REGULATION OF TELEVISION BROADCASTING</font></b></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The ownership, operation
and sale of television stations are subject to the jurisdiction of the FCC,
which acts under the authority granted by the Communications Act of 1934, as
amended (Communications Act).&#160; Among other
things, the FCC assigns frequency bands for broadcasting; determines the
particular frequencies, locations and operating power of stations; issues,
renews, revokes and modifies station licenses; regulates equipment used by
stations; adopts and implements regulations and policies that directly or
indirectly affect the ownership, operation and employment practices of
stations; and has the power to impose penalties for violations of its rules or
the Communications Act.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a brief
summary of certain provisions of the Communications Act, the Telecommunications
Act of 1996 (the 1996 Act) and specific FCC regulations and policies.&#160; Reference should be made to the
Communications Act, the 1996 Act, FCC rules and the public notices and rulings
of the FCC for further information concerning the nature and extent of federal
regulation of broadcast stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">License Grant and
Renewal</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Television stations
operate pursuant to broadcasting licenses that are granted by the FCC for
maximum terms of eight years and are subject to renewal upon application to the
FCC.&#160; During certain periods when renewal
applications are pending, petitions to deny license renewals can be filed by
interested parties, including members of the public.&#160; The FCC will generally grant a renewal application
if it finds:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>that the station has served the
public interest, convenience and necessity;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>that there have been no serious
violations by the licensee of the Communications Act or the rules and
regulations of the FCC; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>that there have been no other
violations by the licensee of the Communications Act or the rules and
regulations of the FCC that, when taken together, would constitute a pattern of
misconduct.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\skannan\06-1921-1\task931277\1921-1-ba-01.htm',USER='skannan',CD='Mar 16 21:15 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of the stations that
we currently own and operate or provide programming services or sales services
to, pursuant to LMAs or other agreements, are presently operating under regular
licenses, which expire as to each station on the dates set forth under <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Television Broadcasting</font></i> above.&#160; Although renewal of a license is granted in
the vast majority of cases even when petitions to deny are filed, there can be
no assurance that the license of any station will be renewed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, we filed with
the FCC an application for the license renewal of WBFF-TV in Baltimore,
Maryland.&#160; Subsequently, an individual
named Richard D&#146;Amato filed a petition to deny the application.&#160; In 2004, we also filed with the FCC
applications for the license renewals of television stations: &#160;WXLV-TV in Winston-Salem, North Carolina;
WUPN-TV in Greensboro, North Carolina; WLFL-TV in Raleigh/Durham, North
Carolina; WRDC-TV in Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WLOS-TV in Asheville,
North Carolina and WMMP-TV in Charleston, South Carolina.&#160; An organization calling itself &#147;Free Press&#148;
filed a petition to deny the renewal applications of these stations and also
the renewal applications of two other stations in those markets: WTAT-TV in
Charleston, South Carolina and WBSC-TV in Anderson, South Carolina; that we
program pursuant to LMAs.&#160; Several
individuals and an organization named &#147;Sinclair Media Watch&#148; also filed
informal objections to the license renewal applications of WLOS and WBSC,
raising essentially the same arguments presented in the Free Press
petition.&#160; The FCC is currently in the
process of considering these renewal applications and we believe the objections
have no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August 1, 2005, we
filed applications with the FCC requesting renewal of the broadcast licenses
for WICS-TV and WICD-TV in Springfield/Champaign, Illinois.&#160; Subsequently, various viewers filed informal
objections requesting that the FCC deny these renewal applications.&#160; Also on August 1, 2005, we filed applications
with the FCC requesting renewal of the broadcast licenses for WCGV-TV and
WVTV-TV in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.&#160; On
November 1, 2005, the Milwaukee Public Interest Media Coalition filed a
petition with the FCC to deny these renewal applications.&#160; On September 30, 2005, we filed an
application with the FCC for the renewal of the broadcast license for KGAN-TV
in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.&#160; On December 28,
2005, an organization calling itself &#147;Iowans for Better Local Television&#148; filed
a petition to deny that application.&#160; The
FCC is currently in the process of considering these renewal applications and
we believe the objections and petitions requesting denial have no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July 21, 2005, we
filed with the FCC an application to acquire WNAB-TV in Nashville,
Tennessee.&#160; Rainbow/PUSH filed a petition
to deny that application and also requested that the FCC initiate a hearing to
investigate whether WNAB was improperly operated with WZTV-TV and WUXP-TV, two
of our stations located in the same market as WNAB.&#160; That proceeding is currently pending and we
believe the petition has no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 12, 2004, the
FCC issued a Notice of Apparent Liability for Forfeiture (NAL) in the amount of
$7,000 per station to virtually every FOX station, including the 15 FOX
affiliates presently licensed to us and the four FOX affiliates programmed by
us and one FOX affiliate we sold in 2005.&#160;
The NAL alleged that the stations broadcast indecent material contained
in an episode of a FOX network program that aired on April 7, 2003.&#160; We, as well as other parties including the FOX
network, filed oppositions to the NAL.&#160;
That proceeding is still pending.&#160;
Although we cannot predict the outcome of that proceeding or the effect
of any adverse outcome on the stations&#146; license renewal applications, the FOX
network has agreed to indemnify its affiliates for the full amount of this liability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Action on many license
renewal applications, including those we have filed, has been delayed because
of the pendency of complaints that programming aired by the various networks
contained indecent material.&#160; We cannot
predict when the FCC will address these complaints and act on the renewal
applications.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent actions by the FCC
have also made it difficult for us to predict the impact on our license
renewals from allegations related to the airing of indecent material that may
arise in the ordinary course of our business.&#160;
For example, on Veterans&#146; Day in November 2004, we preempted (did not
air) &#147;Saving Private Ryan&#148;, a program that was aired during ABC&#146;s network
programming time.&#160; We felt that the
program contained indecent material as defined by the FCC and could result in a
fine or other negative consequences for one or more of our ABC stations.&#160; In February 2005, the FCC dismissed all
complaints filed against ABC stations regarding this program.&#160; The FCC&#146;s decision justified what some may
consider indecent material as appropriate in the context of the program.&#160; Although this ruling has expanded the
programming opportunities of our stations, it still leaves us at risk because
of what might be determined as legitimate context by us may not be deemed so by
the FCC.&#160; We only know that &#147;Saving
Private Ryan&#148; and &#147;Schindler&#146;s List&#148; are allowed to be aired in their entirety
under current FCC rulings.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ownership Matters</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">General</font></i>.&#160; The Communications Act prohibits the
assignment of a broadcast license or the transfer of control of a broadcast
license without the prior approval of the FCC.&#160;
In determining whether to permit the assignment or transfer of control
of, or the grant or renewal of, a broadcast license, the FCC considers a number
of factors pertaining to the licensee, including compliance with various rules
limiting common ownership of media properties, the &#147;character&#148; of the licensee
and those persons holding &#147;attributable&#148; interests in that licensee and
compliance with the Communications Act&#146;s limitations on alien ownership.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
