<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;Net
broadcast revenues&#148; are defined as broadcast revenues, net of agency commission.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Depreciation
and amortization includes amortization of program contract costs and net
realizable value adjustments, depreciation and amortization of property and
equipment and amortization of acquired intangible broadcasting assets, other
assets and costs related to excess syndicated programming.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Interest
expense amounts for the years presented differ from prior years related to
allocation of interest expense to discontinued operations.&#160; Accordingly, we reclassified interest expense
to discontinued operations in the amounts of $3.6 million, $7.7 million, $6.8
million, $8.1 million and $12.7 million for the years ended December 31, 2005,
2004, 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Subsidiary
trust minority expense represents the distributions on the HYTOPS and
amortization of deferred finance costs.&#160;
See footnote (f).</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>&#147;Total
debt&#148; is defined as long-term debt, net of unamortized discount and capital
lease obligations, including the current portion thereof.&#160; Total debt does not include HYTOPS or our
preferred stock.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HYTOPS
represents our high yield trust originated preferred securities representing
$200 million aggregate liquidation value, which were redeemed in 2003.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_111046"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM
7.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>MANAGEMENT&#146;S
DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.25in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">The
following Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis provides qualitative and
quantitative information about our financial performance and condition and
should be read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements and
the accompanying notes to those statements.&#160;
This discussion consists of the following sections:</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Executive Overview</font></u></i> &#150; a
description of our business, financial highlights from 2005, information about
industry trends and sources of revenues and operating costs;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates</font></u></i>
&#150; a discussion of the accounting policies that are most important in
understanding the assumptions and judgments incorporated in the consolidated
financial statements and a summary of recent accounting pronouncements;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Results of Operations</font></u></i> &#150; a
summary of the components of our revenues by category and by network
affiliation, a summary of other operating data and an analysis of our revenues
and expenses for 2005, 2004 and 2003, including comparisons between years and
expectations for 2006; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></u></i>
&#150; a discussion of our primary sources of liquidity, an analysis of our cash
flows from or used in operating activities, investing activities and financing
activities, a discussion of our dividend policy and a summary of our
contractual cash obligations and off-balance sheet arrangements.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">EXECUTIVE
OVERVIEW</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are one of the largest and most diversified
television broadcasting companies in the United States.&#160; We currently own, provide programming and
operating services pursuant to local marketing agreements (LMAs) or provide, or
are provided, sales services pursuant to outsourcing agreements to 58
television stations in 36 markets.&#160; For
the purpose of this report, these 58 stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148;
stations.&#160; We currently have 11 duopoly
markets where we own and operate two stations within the same market.&#160; We have nine LMA markets where, with one
exception, we own and operate one station in the market and provide programming
and operating services to, or by, another station within the market.&#160; In the remaining 16 markets, we own and
operate a single television station.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We believe that owning duopolies and operating
stations under LMAs enables us to accomplish two very important strategic
business objectives: increasing our share of revenues available in each market
and operating television stations more efficiently by minimizing costs.&#160; We constantly monitor revenue share and cost
efficiencies and we aggressively pursue opportunities to improve both by using
new technology and by sharing best practices among our station groups.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair Television Group, Inc. (STG), a wholly owned
subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. (SBG), is the primary obligor
under our existing Bank Credit Agreement, as amended, the 8.75% Senior
Subordinated Notes, due 2011 and the 8% Senior Subordinated Notes, due
2012.&#160; Our Class A Common Stock, Class B
Common Stock, the 6.0% Convertible Debentures, due 2012 and the 4.875%
Convertible Senior Notes, due 2018 remain obligations or securities of SBG and
are not obligations or securities of STG.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2005 Highlights</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Operating income increased 7.1% in
2005 due to expense controls and greater efficiencies in our direct mail new
business initiative;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Basic and diluted earnings per share
were $2.14 in 2005 versus 2004 earnings per share of $0.16;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Local time sales, excluding
political, increased 1.9% in 2005 as a result of our continued focus on new
business initiatives including direct mail;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Retransmission fees increased $15.7
million over 2004, including a one-time adjustment of $2.9 million, and, based
on current contracts, 2006 retransmission fee consideration is expected to be
approximately $25.0 million as a result of our efforts to monetize our
retransmission agreements;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Ratings increases at our ABC and FOX
stations have resulted in revenue share growth in many of our markets;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We completed the sales of KOVR-TV (CBS)
in Sacramento, California and KSMO-TV (WB) in Kansas City, Missouri during 2005
and we completed the sale of WEMT-TV (FOX) in Tri-Cities, Tennessee in January
2006;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We increased our annual dividend rate
to $0.40 per common share at the end of 2005 from $0.10 per common share at the
end of 2004;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We exchanged our 6% Convertible
Preferred Stock for 6% Convertible Debentures, due 2012 in June 2005;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We entered into a news share
arrangement with WIAT-TV, the CBS affiliate in Birmingham, Alabama, in order to
improve the performance of our news operations of our WB affiliate WTTO-TV; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We entered into a joint sales and
services agreement with Nexstar Broadcasting in Rochester, New York combining
their CBS station with our FOX station, in order to improve station
performance.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We believe that all of
these events will enhance shareholder value.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Industry
Trends</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Political advertising increases in
even-numbered years, such as 2004, due to the advertising expenditures from
candidates running in local and national elections.&#160;&#160; In every fourth year, such as 2004,
political advertising is elevated further due to the presidential election;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Seasonal advertising increases in the
second and fourth quarters due to the advertising expenditures related to the
anticipation of certain seasonal and holiday spending by consumers;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Not all cable system operators and
satellite providers pay for the analog or digital signals they receive from
broadcasters, but we expect more operators and providers will be paying for
these signals in the future as alternative competing video delivery providers
increase;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Compensation from networks to their
affiliates in exchange for broadcasting of network programming has
significantly declined in recent years and may be eliminated in the future in
lieu of alternative network and affiliate relationships;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Automotive-related advertising is a
significant portion of our total net revenues in all periods presented and
these revenues have been trending downward in recent years and we expect this
trend to modify in 2006;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Federal Communications Commission
(FCC) has mandated that beginning February 17, 2009, all broadcast television
stations must broadcast using only a digital signal and will no longer be able
to broadcast using an analog signal;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The FCC has permitted broadcast
television stations to use their digital spectrum for a wide variety of
services including multi-channel broadcasts.&#160;
We have announced that we plan to launch a second digital channel using WBFF-TV&#146;s
digital signal in Baltimore, Maryland on May 1, 2006; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Many broadcasters are
enhancing/upgrading their websites to use the internet to deliver rich media
content, such as newscasts and weather updates, to attract advertisers.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Sources of Revenues and Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Most of our revenues are generated from the
transactional spot market rather than the traditional &#147;up front&#148; and &#147;scatter&#148;
markets that networks access. These operating revenues are derived from local
and national advertisers and, to a much lesser extent, from political
advertisers.&#160; Recently, we have begun to generate revenues
from our retransmission fee arrangements, which has replaced the steady decline
in revenues from television network compensation.&#160; Our revenues from local advertisers have
continued to trend upward and revenues from national advertisers have continued
to trend downward when measured as a percentage of gross broadcast revenue.&#160; We believe this trend is the result of our
focus on increasing local advertising revenues as a percentage of total
advertising revenues, combined with a decrease in overall spending by national
advertisers and an increase in the number of competitive media outlets
providing national advertisers multiple alternatives in which to advertise
their goods or services.&#160; Our efforts to
mitigate the effect of these increasing competitive media outlets for national
advertisers include continuing our efforts to increase local revenues and
developing innovative sales and marketing strategies to sell traditional and
non-traditional services to our advertisers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary operating expenses are syndicated program
rights fees, commissions on revenues, employee salaries, news gathering and
station promotional costs.&#160; Amortization
and depreciation of costs other than goodwill associated with the acquisition
of our stations and interest carrying charges are significant factors in
determining our overall profitability.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">CRITICAL
ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This discussion and analysis of our financial
condition and results of operations is based on our consolidated financial
statements which have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally
accepted in the United States.&#160; The
preparation of these financial statements requires us to make estimates and
judgments that affect the reported amount of assets, liabilities, revenues and
expenses and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities.&#160; On an on-going basis, we evaluate our
estimates including those related to bad debts, program contract costs,
intangible assets, income taxes, property and equipment, investments and
derivative contracts.&#160; We base our
estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions that are
believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form
the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and
liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources.&#160; These estimates have been consistently
applied for all years presented in this report and in the past we have not
experienced material differences between these estimates and actual results.&#160; However, because future events and their
effects cannot be determined with certainty, actual results could differ from
our estimates and such differences could be material.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have identified the policies below as critical to
our business operations and the understanding of our results of
operations.&#160; For a detailed discussion on
the application of these and other accounting policies, see <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 1. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies,</font></i>
in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue Recognition</font></i>.&#160; Advertising revenues, net of agency and national
representatives&#146; commissions, are recognized in the period during which time
spots are aired.&#160; All other revenues are
recognized as services are provided.&#160; The
revenues realized from station barter arrangements are recorded as the programs
are aired at the estimated fair value of the advertising airtime given in
exchange for the program rights.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allowance
for Doubtful Accounts</font></i>.&#160;
We maintain an allowance for doubtful accounts for estimated losses
resulting from extending credit to our customers that are unable to make
required payments.&#160; If the economy and/or
the financial condition of our customers were to deteriorate, resulting in an
impairment of their ability to make payments, additional allowances may be required.&#160; For example, a 10% increase of the balance of
our allowance for doubtful accounts as of December 31, 2005, would reduce net
income available to common shareholders by approximately $0.5 million.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Program
Contract Costs</font></i>.&#160; We
have agreements with distributors for the rights to televise programming over
contract periods, which generally run from one to seven years.&#160; Contract payments are made in installments
over terms that are generally equal to or shorter than the contract period.&#160; Each contract is recorded as an asset and a
liability at an amount equal to its gross cash contractual commitment when the
license period begins and the program is available for its first showing.&#160; The portion of program contracts which become
payable within one year is reflected as a current liability in the consolidated
balance sheets.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The programming rights are reflected in the
consolidated balance sheets at the lower of unamortized cost or estimated net
realizable value (NRV).&#160; Estimated NRVs
are based on management&#146;s expectation of future advertising revenue, net of
sales commissions, to be generated by the remaining program material available
under the contract terms.&#160; Amortization
of program contract costs is generally computed using a four year accelerated
method or a straight-line method, depending on the length of the contract.&#160; Program contract costs estimated by
management to be amortized within one year are classified as current
assets.&#160; Payment of program contract
liabilities are typically paid on a scheduled basis and are not reflected by
adjustments for amortization or estimated NRV.&#160;
If our estimate of future advertising revenues declines, then additional
write downs to NRV may be required.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Valuation
of Goodwill, Long-Lived Assets and Intangible Assets</font></i>.&#160; We periodically evaluate our goodwill, broadcast
licenses, long-lived assets and intangible assets for potential impairment
indicators.&#160; Our judgments regarding the
existence of impairment indicators are based on estimated future cash flows,
market conditions, operating performance of our stations and legal
factors.&#160; Future events could cause us to
conclude that impairment indicators exist and that the net book value of
long-lived assets and intangible assets is impaired.&#160; Any resulting impairment loss could have a
material adverse impact on our consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements
of operations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined our broadcast licenses to be
indefinite-lived intangible assets under SFAS No. 142, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</font></i>,
which requires such assets to be tested for impairment on an annual basis along
with our goodwill.&#160; We test our broadcast
licenses and goodwill by estimating the fair market value of these assets for
each of our markets using a combination of quoted market prices, observed
earnings multiples paid for comparable television station, discounted cash flow
models and appraisals.&#160; We then compare
the estimated fair market value to the book value of these assets to determine
if an impairment exists.&#160; Our discounted
cash flow model is based on our judgment of future market conditions within
each designated marketing area, as well as discount rates that would be used by
market participants in an arms-length transaction.&#160; Future events could cause us to conclude that
market conditions have declined or discount rates have increased </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to the extent that our broadcast licenses and/or goodwill could be
impaired.&#160; Any resulting impairment loss
could have a material adverse impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations and consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
Taxes</font></i>.&#160; We recognize
deferred tax assets and liabilities based on the differences between the
financial statements carrying amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160; We provide a valuation allowance for deferred
tax assets relating to various federal and state net operating losses (NOL)
that are carried forward based on the expected timing of the reversals of
existing temporary book/tax basis differences, alternative tax strategies and
projected future taxable income.&#160; As of
December 31, 2005, valuation allowances have been provided for a substantial
amount of our available federal and state NOLs.&#160;
Although realization is not assured for the remaining deferred tax
assets, we believe that it is more likely than not that they will be realized
in the future.&#160; If we are unable to
generate sufficient taxable income, or if there is a material change in our
projected taxable income or if there is a change in our ability to use NOL
carryforwards due to changes in federal and state laws, we will make any
necessary adjustments to the valuation allowance.&#160; This may result in a substantial increase in
our effective tax rate and a material adverse effect on our consolidated balance
sheets, consolidated statements of operations and consolidated statements of cash
flows.&#160; Management periodically performs
a comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax
contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews,
the status of ongoing audits and the expiration of applicable statute of
limitations, reserves are adjusted as necessary.&#160; The resolution of audits is unpredictable and
could result in tax liabilities that are significantly higher or lower than
that which has been provided by us.&#160; We
believe our reserves are adequate.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent Accounting
Pronouncements</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 16, 2004, the Financial Accounting
Standards Board (FASB) issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.
123R, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Share-Based Payment</font></i> (SFAS
123R) as a revision to FASB Statement No. 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Stock-Based Compensation</font></i>.&#160;
We adopted SFAS 123R on January 1, 2006 and we will use the modified
prospective transition to account for future share-based payments.&#160; SFAS 123R supersedes Accounting Principles
Board Opinion No. 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock
Issued to Employees </font></i>(Opinion 25), and amends FASB Statement No. 95, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Statement of Cash Flows</font></i>.&#160; This standard requires that all share-based
payments, including grants of employee stock options and our employee stock purchase
plan, be recognized in the income statement as compensation expense based on
their fair values.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April 21, 2005, we accelerated the vesting of
390,039 stock options, which were all of our outstanding unvested options at
that time.&#160; We accelerated the vesting of
these options to prevent recognizing an expense of approximately $0.8 million
(pre-tax) in future periods in accordance with SFAS 123R.&#160; The acceleration of the vesting effectively
resulted in a modification to the original options.&#160; In accordance with FASB Interpretation No.
44, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Certain Transactions
Involving Stock Based Compensation</font></i>, we recorded an immaterial
compensation charge based on the intrinsic value of the awards as measured on
the modification date.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 123R will require us to recognize a compensation
charge for our Employee Stock Purchase Plan.&#160;
For the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, we estimate that
this amount would have been $0.2 million, $0.3 million and $0.4 million,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March 2005, the FASB issued FASB Interpretation No.
47, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Conditional Asset
Retirement Obligations, an Interpretation of FASB Statement No. 143</font></i>
(FIN 47), which clarifies the term &#147;conditional asset retirement obligation&#148; as
used in SFAS No. 143, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Asset
Retirement Obligations</font></i>.&#160; FIN
47 is effective for fiscal years ending after December 15, 2005 and we adopted
it upon issuance.&#160; FIN 47 provides that
an asset retirement obligation is conditional when either the timing and/or
method of settling the obligation is conditioned on a future event.&#160; Accordingly, an entity is required to
recognize a liability for the fair value of a conditional asset retirement
obligation if the fair value of the liability can be reasonably estimated.&#160; Uncertainty about the timing and/or method of
settlement of a conditional asset retirement obligation should be factored into
the measurement of the liability when sufficient information exists.&#160; This interpretation also clarifies when an
entity would have sufficient information to reasonably estimate the fair value
of an asset retirement obligation.&#160; The
adoption of FIN 47 did not have a material impact on our consolidated balance
sheets, consolidated statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash
flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the Emerging Issues Task Force (EITF)
issued EITF No. 05-6, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Determining the
Amortization Period for Leasehold Improvements</font></i> (EITF 05-6).&#160; EITF 05-6 addresses the amortization period
for leasehold improvements acquired in a business combination or purchased
subsequent to the inception of the lease.&#160;
EITF 05-6 was effective for reporting periods beginning after July 1,
2005.&#160; The adoption of this pronouncement
did not have a material impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">RESULTS
OF OPERATIONS</font></i></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, this discussion is related to the results
of our continuing operations, except for discussions regarding our cash flows
(which also include the results of our discontinued operations).&#160; Unless otherwise indicated, references in
this discussion to 2005, 2004 and 2003 are to our fiscal years ended December
31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160;
Additionally, any references to the first, second, third or fourth
quarters are to the three months ended March 31, June 30, September 30 and
December 31, respectively, for the year being discussed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Broadcast Revenues</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Set forth below are the principal types of broadcast
revenues from continuing operations received by our stations for the periods
indicated and the percentage contribution of each type to our total gross
broadcast revenues (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>

  </td>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.66%;">

  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.42%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.66%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">685.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160; 2005 Retransmission fee revenue includes a
one-time adjustment of $2.9 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary types of
programming and their approximate percentages of 2005 net broadcast revenues
from continuing operations were syndicated programming (46.4%), network
programming (21.4%), news (13.6%), direct advertising programming (8.0%),
sports programming (6.0%), children&#146;s programming (0.4%) and other
programming.&#160; Similarly, our five largest
categories of advertising and their approximate percentages of 2005 net
broadcast revenues were automotive (23.8%), professional services (13.8%), paid
programming including religious programming (8.3%), fast food (7.3%) and retail
department stores (6.6%).&#160; Other than schools,
no other advertising category accounted for more than 5.0% of our broadcast
revenues in 2005.&#160; Along with the
industry, we have seen softness in the auto advertising category and we expect
this to continue in 2006.&#160; No individual
advertiser accounted for more than 1.0% of our consolidated net broadcast
revenues in 2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>During
2005, several of our stations switched affiliates.&#160; We have restated the revenue from those
stations in prior years for comparability.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>2004
includes significantly more political revenue than 2005 and 2003 for most of
our affiliates.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>During
2004, we entered into agreements to sell our CBS station in Sacramento,
California and our WB station in Kansas City, Missouri.&#160; During 2005, we entered into an agreement to
sell our FOX station in Tri-Cities, Tennessee.&#160;
The time sales from these stations are not included in this table
because they are accounted for as time sales from discontinued operations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
the fall of 2006, our composition of network affiliates will change as a result
of our recent agreement to air MyNetworkTV programming and the recent
announcements about the merger of UPN and The WB into a network to be called
The CW.&#160; Refer to our <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Markets and Stations</font></i> table on page 5 and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 18. Subsequent Events, </font></i>in the Notes to our Consolidated
Financial Statements for addition information.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Stations
without a network affiliation.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Data</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 (in millions).&#160; For definitions of terms, see the footnotes
to the table in <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Item 6. Selected Financial
Data</font></i>.</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(96.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">632.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="31%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total National</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">214.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">242.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">230.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="31%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="31%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
  Broadcasting Revenues</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">614.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">634.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">611.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Net
Broadcast Revenues</font></i>.&#160;
From a revenue category standpoint, the year ended December 31, 2005,
when compared to 2004, was negatively impacted by a decrease of advertising
revenues generated from the political, automotive, movies, telecommunications
and food-breakfast sectors, offset by increases in the services, schools and
entertainment sectors.&#160; Automotive, our
single largest category, representing 23.8% of the year&#146;s net time sales, was
down 5.1%.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Political
Revenues.&#160; </font></i>Both local
and national political revenues were the primary drivers of higher revenue in
2004, compared to 2005 because 2004 was a presidential election year.&#160; In fact, we own television stations in 11 of
the 16 so called &#147;Battleground States&#148; including multiple stations in Ohio,
Florida and West Virginia.&#160; We expect
political revenues to increase in 2006 from 2005 levels, but not to the extent
of political revenues from 2004 since 2006 is not a presidential election year.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Local
Revenues</font></i>.&#160; Our revenues
from local advertisers, excluding political revenues, increased during the year
ended December 31, 2005 when compared to 2004.&#160;
We continue to focus on increasing local advertising revenues through
innovative sales and marketing strategies in our markets.&#160; Revenues from our new business initiatives
increased by $11.0 million during the year ended December 31, 2005 to $26.4
million from $15.4 million during 2004. &#160;We expect to continue our focus on new
business revenues in 2006. &#160;Additionally,
during 2004, we implemented an enhanced sales training course for all of our
salespeople with a focus on local revenue sales. We have continued these
efforts throughout 2005 and will continue these efforts in 2006.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">National
Revenues.&#160; </font></i>Our revenues
from national advertisers, excluding political revenues, have continued to
trend downward over time.&#160; We believe
this trend represents a shift in the way national advertising dollars are being
spent and we believe it has recently begun accelerating.&#160; Advertisers in major categories like
automotive, soft drink and packaged goods are shifting significant portions of
their advertising budgets away from spot television into non-traditional media,
in-store promotions and product placement in network shows<font style="background:white;">.&#160; We expect
this trend to continue into 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Revenues and Expenses.&#160; </font></i>Our
other revenues consist primarily of network compensation, revenues from
retransmission agreements with cable and satellite providers, production
revenues and revenues from our outsourcing agreements.&#160; Compared to 2004, other revenues increased
$9.3 million during the year ended December 31, 2005.&#160; The increase in other revenues is primarily
related to increased retransmission revenues which increased $8.7 million in
2005, excluding a one-time adjustment of $2.9 million.&#160; We expect to experience similar growth in our
retransmission revenues in 2006.&#160; We
expect this growth to be partially offset by a reduction in our network
compensation, although we cannot predict the extent of this reduction in light
of the recent CW network merger announcement.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\06-1921-1\task933317\1921-1-ba-03.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Mar 16 16:04 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Expense Discussion and Analysis</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

presents our significant expense categories for the three years ended December
31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 (in millions):</font></p>
