<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-9',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SINCLAIR
BROADCAST GROUP, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="NotesToConsolidated_225118"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>NATURE OF OPERATIONS AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT
ACCOUNTING POLICIES</u>:</b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nature of Operations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair Broadcast Group,
Inc. is a diversified television broadcasting company that owns or provides
certain programming, operating or sales services to television stations
pursuant to broadcasting licenses that are granted by the Federal
Communications Commission.&#160; We currently
own, provide programming and operating services pursuant to local marketing
agreements (LMAs) or provide, or are provided, sales services pursuant to
outsourcing agreements to 58 television stations in 36 markets.&#160; For the purpose of this report, these 58
stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148; stations.&#160;
We currently have 11 duopoly markets where we own and operate at least
two or more stations within the same market.&#160;
We have nine LMA markets where, with one exception, we own and operate
one station in the market and provide programming and operating services to, or
by, another station within the market.&#160;
In the remaining 16 markets, we own and operate a single television
station.&#160; Our television station group is
a single reportable segment for accounting purposes and is diverse in network
affiliation with 19 stations affiliated with FOX, 18 with The WB, 10 with ABC,
six with UPN, two with CBS and one with NBC.&#160;
Two of our stations are not affiliated with any network.&#160; In the fall of 2006, our composition of
network affiliates will change as a result of our recent agreement to air
MyNetworkTV programming and the recent announcements about the merger of UPN
and The WB into a network to be called The CW.&#160;
Refer to <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 18.</font></i>  <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Subsequent
Events,</font></i> for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Principles of Consolidation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The consolidated
financial statements include our accounts and those of our wholly-owned and
majority-owned subsidiaries and variable interest entities.&#160; Minority interest represents a minority
owner&#146;s proportionate share of the equity in certain of our consolidated
entities.&#160; All significant intercompany
transactions and account balances have been eliminated in consolidation.&#160; The financial statements for the unrelated
third party owner of WNAB-TV in Nashville, Tennessee, a variable interest
entity for which we are a primary beneficiary, have been consolidated since
March 31, 2004.&#160; (See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Variable Interest Entities</font></i> below.)</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Discontinued
Operations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards (SFAS) No. 144, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for the
Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</font></i>, we reported the
financial position and results of operations of KOVR-TV in Sacramento,
California, KSMO-TV in Kansas City, Missouri and WEMT-TV in Tri-Cities,
Tennessee as discontinued operations in the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets and consolidated statements of operations.&#160; Discontinued operations have not been segregated
in the consolidated statements of cash flows and, therefore, amounts for
certain captions will not agree with the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets and consolidated statements of operations.&#160; The operating results of KOVR, KSMO and WEMT
are not included in our consolidated results from continuing operations for the
years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003.&#160;
In accordance with Emerging Issues Task Force Issue No. 87-24, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Allocation of Interest to Discontinued Operations</font></i>, we have
allocated $3.6 million, $7.7 million and $6.8 million of interest expense to
discontinued operations for years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 12.</font></i>
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Discontinued Operations,</font></i> for additional
information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Use of Estimates</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of financial statements in accordance
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported
amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses in the consolidated
financial statements and in the disclosures of contingent assets and
liabilities.&#160; Actual results could differ
from those estimates.&#160; </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-10</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-10',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 16, 2004, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards No. 123R, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Share-Based
Payment</font></i> (SFAS 123R) as a revision to FASB Statement No. 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation</font></i>.&#160; We adopted SFAS 123R on January 1, 2006 and
we will use the modified prospective transition to account for future
share-based payments.&#160; SFAS 123R
supersedes Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees </font></i>(Opinion
25), and amends FASB Statement No. 95, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Statement
of Cash Flows</font></i>.&#160; This standard
requires that all share-based payments, including grants of employee stock
options and our employee stock purchase plan, be recognized in the income
statement as compensation expense based on their fair values.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April 21, 2005, we
accelerated the vesting of 390,039 stock options, which were all of our
outstanding unvested options at that time.&#160;
We accelerated the vesting of these options to prevent recognizing an
expense of approximately $0.8 million (pre-tax) in future periods in accordance
with SFAS 123R.&#160; The acceleration of the
vesting effectively resulted in a modification to the original options.&#160; In accordance with FASB Interpretation No.
44, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Certain Transactions
Involving Stock Based Compensation</font></i>, we recorded an immaterial compensation
charge based on the intrinsic value of the awards as measured on the
modification date.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS 123R will require us
to recognize a compensation charge for our Employee Stock Purchase Plan.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004
and 2003, we estimate that this amount would have been $0.2 million, $0.3
million and $0.4 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March 2005, the FASB
issued FASB Interpretation No. 47, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Conditional Asset Retirement Obligations, an Interpretation of FASB
Statement No. 143</font></i> (FIN 47), which clarifies the term &#147;conditional
asset retirement obligation&#148; as used in SFAS No. 143, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Asset Retirement Obligations</font></i>.&#160; FIN 47 is effective for fiscal years ending
after December 15, 2005 and we adopted it upon issuance.&#160; FIN 47 provides that an asset retirement
obligation is conditional when either the timing and/or method of settling the
obligation is conditioned on a future event.&#160;
Accordingly, an entity is required to recognize a liability for the fair
value of a conditional asset retirement obligation if the fair value of the
liability can be reasonably estimated.&#160;
Uncertainty about the timing and/or method of settlement of a
conditional asset retirement obligation should be factored into the measurement
of the liability when sufficient information exists.&#160; This interpretation also clarifies when an
entity would have sufficient information to reasonably estimate the fair value
of an asset retirement obligation.&#160; The
adoption of FIN 47 did not have a material impact on our consolidated balance
sheets, consolidated statements of operations or consolidated statements of
cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Emerging Issues Task Force (EITF) issued EITF No. 05-6, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Determining
the Amortization Period for Leasehold Improvements</font></i> (EITF 05-6).&#160; EITF 05-6 addresses the amortization period
for leasehold improvements acquired in a business combination or purchased
subsequent to the inception of the lease.&#160;
EITF 05-6 was effective for reporting periods beginning after July 1,
2005.&#160; The adoption of this pronouncement
did not have a material impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Variable Interest Entities</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2003,
the FASB issued Interpretation No. 46 (revised December 2003), <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidation of Variable Interest Entities, an
Interpretation of Accounting Research Bulletin No. 51</font></i> (FIN
46R).&#160; FIN 46R introduces the variable
interest entity consolidation model, which determines control and consolidation
based on potential variability in gains and losses of the entity being
evaluated for consolidation.&#160; We adopted
FIN 46R on March 31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined
that WNAB-TV in Nashville, Tennessee continues to be a variable interest entity
(VIE) and that we remain the primary beneficiary of the variable interest as a
result of the terms of our outsourcing agreement and the remaining option
payment.&#160; As a result, we continue to
consolidate the assets and liabilities of WNAB at their fair values, which have
been adjusted to reflect an appraisal prepared in connection with the closing
of the non-license assets.&#160; Goodwill and
FCC license book values were increased by $5.8 million and $4.2 million,
respectively, upon the closing of the non-license assets in May 2005.&#160; The consolidated assets of WNAB consist of
broadcast licenses of $18.5 million, network affiliation of $2.3 million and
property and equipment of $2.9 million.&#160;
The consolidation of WNAB did not have a material impact on our statements
of operations.&#160; We made payments to the
unrelated third party owner of WNAB of $1.7 million and $2.2 million related to
our outsourcing agreement for the years ended December 31, 2005 and 2004,
respectively.&#160; On January 2, 2003, we
made an $18.0 million non-refundable deposit against the purchase price of the
put or call options on the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-11</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-11',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">non-license assets.&#160; We believe that our maximum exposure to loss
as a result of our involvement with WNAB consists of the fees that we pay related
to the outsourcing agreement, as well as any payments that we would be required
to make under the put options held by the current owner related to the license
and non-license assets.&#160; (See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 10. Commitments and Contingencies</font></i>.)</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 25, 2005,
we exercised the option agreements to acquire certain license and non-license
assets of WNAB for $5.0 million and $8.3 million, respectively.&#160; On May 31, 2005, we completed the purchase of
the non-license broadcast assets.&#160; The
closing on the license assets is pending approval by the FCC.&#160; We paid $4.5 million of the license asset
exercise price on December 23, 2005.&#160; If
the FCC has not granted approval by December 22, 2006, we will be required to
pay the remaining $0.5 million to the unrelated third party.&#160; On August 25, 2005, the Rainbow/PUSH
Coalition filed a petition with the FCC to deny the transfer of the WNAB
broadcast license to us.&#160; The FCC is
currently in the process of considering the transfer of the broadcast
license.&#160; We believe the Rainbow/PUSH
petition has no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined
that Cunningham Broadcasting Corporation (Cunningham) is a VIE and that we are
the primary beneficiary of the variable interests.&#160; We have been consolidating Cunningham&#146;s
financial statements since February 1, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined
that we had a variable interest in WTXL-TV in Tallahassee, Florida as a result
of the terms of the outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third-party owner
of WTXL.&#160; However, we had determined that
we were not the primary beneficiary of the variable interests and, therefore,
we were not required to consolidate WTXL under the provisions of FASB
Interpretation No. 46 (revised December 2003), <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidation
of Variable Interest Entity, an Interpretation of Accounting Research Bulletin
No. 51</font></i>.&#160; As of December 31,
2005, we believed that we did not have a material exposure to loss as a result
of our involvement with WTXL.&#160; On
February 19, 2006, we terminated our outsourcing agreement with the unrelated
third party owner of WTXL.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash and Cash Equivalents</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We consider all
highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less
when purchased to be cash equivalents.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Accounts Receivable</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management
regularly reviews accounts receivable and determines an appropriate estimate
for the allowance for doubtful accounts based upon the impact of economic
conditions on the merchant&#146;s ability to pay, past collection experience and
such other factors which, in management&#146;s judgment, deserve current
recognition.&#160; In turn, a provision is
charged against earnings in order to maintain the allowance level.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Programming</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have agreements
with distributors for the rights to television programming over contract
periods, which generally run from one to seven years.&#160; Contract payments are made in installments
over terms that are generally equal to or shorter than the contract
period.&#160; Each contract is recorded as an
asset and a liability at an amount equal to its gross contractual cash
commitment when the license period begins and the program is available for its
first showing.&#160; The portion of program
contracts which becomes payable within one year is reflected as a current
liability in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The rights to this
programming are reflected in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets at
the lower of unamortized cost or estimated net realizable value.&#160; Estimated net realizable values are based on
management&#146;s expectation of future advertising revenues, net of sales commissions,
to be generated by the program material.&#160;
Amortization of program contract costs is generally computed using
either a four year accelerated method or based on usage, whichever method
results in the most accelerated amortization for each program.&#160; Program contract costs estimated by management
to be amortized in the succeeding year are classified as current assets.&#160; Payments of program contract liabilities are
typically made on a scheduled basis and are not affected by adjustments for
amortization or estimated net realizable value.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-12</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-12',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Barter Arrangements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain program
contracts provide for the exchange of advertising airtime in lieu of cash
payments for the rights to such programming.&#160;
The revenues realized from station barter arrangements are recorded as
the programs are aired at the estimated fair value of the advertising airtime
given in exchange for the program rights.&#160;
Network programming is excluded from these calculations.&#160; Revenues are recorded as revenues realized
from station barter arrangements and the corresponding expenses are recorded as
expenses recognized from station barter arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We broadcast
certain customers&#146; advertising in exchange for equipment, merchandise and
services.&#160; The estimated fair value of
the equipment, merchandise or services received is recorded as deferred barter
costs and the corresponding obligation to broadcast advertising is recorded as
deferred barter revenues.&#160; The deferred
barter costs are expensed or capitalized as they are used, consumed or received
and are included in the station production expenses and the station selling,
general and administrative expenses, as applicable.&#160; Deferred barter revenues are recognized as
the related advertising is aired and are recorded in revenues realized from
station barter arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other assets as of
December 31, 2005 and 2004 consisted of the following (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="85%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.1in;width:85.34%;">

  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15,831</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">82,428</font></p>

</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Investments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use the equity
method of accounting for investments in which we have between 20% and 50%
ownership interest or when we have significant influence over the operations of
the business.&#160; For investments in which
we have more than 50% ownership interest, we consolidate the operations and for
investments in which we have less than 20% ownership interest, we use the lower
of cost or fair market value method of accounting.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 2.</font></i>  <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Investments,</font></i> for more information regarding our investments.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impairment of Long-lived Assets</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the
provisions of SFAS No. 144, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for
the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</font></i> (SFAS 144), we
periodically evaluate our long-lived assets for impairment and will continue to
evaluate them as events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying
amount of such assets may not be fully recoverable.&#160; We evaluate the recoverability of long-lived
assets by measuring the carrying amount of the assets against the estimated
undiscounted future cash flows associated with them.&#160; At the time that such evaluations indicate
that the future undiscounted cash flows of certain long-lived assets are not
sufficient to recover the carrying value of such assets, the assets are
adjusted to their fair values.&#160; As of
December 31, 2005, management believes the carrying amounts of our tangible and
definite-lived intangible assets have not been impaired under SFAS 144.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-13</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">77,291</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not accrue
for repair and maintenance activities in advance of planned or unplanned major
maintenance activities.&#160; We generally
expense these activities when incurred.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recognize
deferred tax assets and liabilities based on the differences between the
financial statements carrying amounts and the tax bases of assets and
liabilities.&#160; We provide a valuation
allowance for deferred tax assets relating to various federal and state net
operating losses (NOL) that are carried forward. &#160;As of December 31, 2005, valuation allowances have
been provided for a substantial amount of our available federal and state NOLs.&#160; We evaluate the need and extent of a
valuation allowance based on the expected timing of the reversals of existing
temporary book/tax differences, alternative tax strategies and projected future
taxable income.&#160; If we are unable to
generate sufficient taxable income, or if there is a material change in our
projected taxable income, or if there is a change in our ability to use NOL
carryforwards due to changes in federal and state laws, we will make any
necessary adjustments to the valuation allowance.&#160; Management periodically performs a
comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax
contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews,
the status of ongoing audits and the expiration of applicable statute of
limitations, accruals are adjusted as necessary.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Supplemental Information - Statement of Cash Flows</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005, 2004 and
2003, we had the following cash transactions (in thousands):</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="56%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:56.9%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Payments related to debt extinguishment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.8%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">628</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.8%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.32%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,168</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.8%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="404" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="73" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="80" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-cash barter
and trade revenue and expense are presented in the consolidated statements of
operations.&#160; Non-cash transactions
related to capital lease obligations were $4.7 million and $2.7 million for the
years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160; There were no capital lease obligation
transactions entered into during 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Local Marketing Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We generally enter
into local marketing agreements (LMAs) and similar arrangements with stations
located in markets in which we already own and operate a station.&#160; Under the terms of these agreements, we make
specified periodic payments to the owner-operator in exchange for the right to
program and sell advertising on a specific portion of the station&#146;s inventory
of broadcast time.&#160; Nevertheless, as the
holder of the FCC license, the owner-operator retains control and responsibility
for the operation of the station, including responsibility over all programming
content broadcasted on the station.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in the
accompanying consolidated statements of operations for the years ended December
31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, are net broadcast revenues of $118.6 million, $114.6
million and $101.7 million, respectively, that relate to LMAs.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-14</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-14',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Outsourcing Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered
into outsourcing agreements in which our stations provide, or are provided,
various non-programming related services such as sales, operational and
managerial services to, or by, other stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising
revenues, net of agency and national representatives&#146; commissions, are
recognized in the period during which time spots are aired.&#160; All other revenues are recognized as services
are provided.&#160; Total revenues include:
(i) cash and barter advertising revenues, net of agency and national
representatives&#146; commissions, (ii) retransmission fees, (iii) network
compensation, (iv) other broadcast revenues and (v) revenues from our other
operating divisions&#146;.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Advertising Expenses</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising
expenses are recorded in the period when incurred and are included in the
station production expenses.&#160; Total advertising
expenses from continuing operations, net of advertising co-op credits, were
$8.3 million, $9.7 million and $10.4 million for the years ended December 31,
2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financial Instruments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial
instruments as of December 31, 2005 and 2004 consisted of cash and cash
equivalents, trade accounts receivable, notes receivable (which are included in
other current assets), accounts payable, accrued liabilities and notes
payable.&#160; The carrying amounts
approximate fair value for each of these financial instruments, except for the
notes payable.&#160; See <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 5. Notes Payable and Commercial Bank Financing,</font></i>
for additional information regarding the fair value of notes payable.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Pro Forma Information Related to Stock-Based Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As permitted under
SFAS No. 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation</font></i> (SFAS 123), we measure compensation expense for our
stock-based employee compensation plans using the intrinsic value method
prescribed by Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</font></i>
and provide pro forma disclosures of net income and earnings per share as if
the fair value-based method prescribed by SFAS 123 had been applied in
measuring compensation expense.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-15</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have computed
for pro forma disclosure purposes the value of all options granted during the
years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively, using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model as prescribed by SFAS 123, using the
following weighted average assumptions:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Adjustments are made for
options forfeited prior to vesting.&#160; All
options were vested as of April 21, 2005.&#160;
Therefore, there are not any applicable assumptions to be listed for the
year ended December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reclassifications</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain
reclassifications have been made to prior years&#146; consolidated financial
statements to conform to the current year&#146;s presentation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><u>INVESTMENTS</u>:</b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allegiance
Capital Limited Partnership</font></u></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31,
2005 and 2004, we had an 87.5% limited partnership interest in Allegiance
Capital Limited Partnership (Allegiance).&#160;
Allegiance is a private mezzanine venture capital fund, which invests in
the subordinated debt and equity of privately held companies.&#160; The partnership is structured as a debenture
Small Business Investment Company (SBIC) and is a federally licensed SBIC.&#160; Since we do not have significant control, but
only significant influence, we account for our investment in Allegiance under
the equity method of accounting.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-16</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-16',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-05.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:25 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Atlantic Automotive Corporation</font></u></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 31, 2005, we entered into an agreement with
Auto Properties LLC, an affiliate of Atlantic Automotive Corporation (&#147;Atlantic
Automotive,&#148; formerly Summa Holdings, Ltd.) to sell our 17.5% equity interest,
or 21.22 shares, in Atlantic Automotive to Auto Properties LLC for
approximately $21.5 million in cash.&#160; On
August 2, 2005, the agreement between us and Auto Properties LLC was nullified
and we entered into new stock purchase agreements with David D. Smith, our
President and Chief Executive Officer and Steven B. Fader, an unrelated third
party, and entered into a stock redemption agreement with Atlantic Automotive,
totaling approximately $21.5 million.&#160;
Pursuant to the stock purchase agreements, on August 2, 2005, 9.87 shares
were sold to each party for $10.0 million in cash and pursuant to the stock
redemption agreements, Atlantic Automotive redeemed the remaining 1.48 shares
of our equity interest for $1.5 million in cash.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have other cost
and equity investments in internet technology, transmitter manufacturing and
venture capital companies.&#160; Management
does not believe that these investments individually, or in the aggregate, are
material to the accompanying consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event that one or more of our investments are
significant, we are required to disclose summarized financial information.&#160; The table below presents the unaudited
summarized financial information for these investments for the years ended
December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impairment of Investments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each quarter, we review our investments for
impairment.&#160; For any investments that
indicate a potential impairment, we estimate the fair values of those
investments using discounted cash flow models, unrelated third party valuations
or industry comparables, based on the various facts available to us.&#160; As a result of these reviews, we recorded an
impairment of equity investees of $1.5 million and $4.0 million in the
consolidated statements of operations for the years ended December 31, 2005 and
2004, respectively.&#160; We did not record an
impairment of equity investees during the year ended December 31, 2003.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-17</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and
equipment are stated at cost, less accumulated depreciation.&#160; Depreciation is computed under the
straight-line method over the following estimated useful lives:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="71%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:71.12%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="60%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:60.96%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings and
  improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:33.86%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10 - 30 years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="60%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:60.96%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:33.86%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5 - 10 years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(277,920</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0.375pt 0in;width:3.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:18.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(243,155</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0.375pt 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="54%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">304,355</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">336,538</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation
related to capital leases is included in depreciation expense in the
consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the first
quarter of 2003, one of our towers in Charleston, West Virginia collapsed
during a severe ice storm.&#160; This tower
was insured and we used the insurance settlement to rebuild the tower and to
replace the other assets that were destroyed by the collapse.&#160; In the fourth quarter of 2004, we completed
substantially all of the construction of the new tower and placed it in
service.&#160; At that time, we recognized a
gain of $3.3 million, representing amounts received from insurance above the
net book value of the old tower.&#160; Of this
amount, $0.1 million was related to business interruption insurance recoveries.&#160; In 2005, we recognized a gain of $1.2
million, which represented additional amounts received from the insurance
settlement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>GOODWILL AND OTHER INTANGIBLE ASSETS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 142, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</font></i> (SFAS
142) requires that goodwill be tested for impairment at the reporting unit
level at least annually.&#160; We have
determined that our designated marketing areas (DMAs) are reporting units under
SFAS 142.&#160; Annually, we test for
impairment by comparing the book value of our reporting units, including
goodwill, to the estimated fair value of our reporting units. &#160;We estimate the fair value of our reporting
units using a combination of quoted market prices, observed earnings multiples
paid for comparable television stations, discounted cash flow models and
appraisals.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-18</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-18',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We tested our
goodwill and indefinite-lived intangible assets for impairment as of October 1,
2005, 2004 and 2003 using the step one/step two methodology provided in SFAS
142.&#160; There were no impairment charges
recorded for 2005 and 2003 based on the results of such testing.&#160; In 2004, we determined that the carrying
value of goodwill of one of our stations exceeded its fair value.&#160; As required, we calculated the fair value of
goodwill and, as a result, we recorded a $44.1 million charge called impairment
of goodwill in our 2004 consolidated statement of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Definite-lived
intangible assets and other assets subject to amortization are being amortized
on a straight-line basis over periods of 5 to 25 years.&#160; These amounts result from the acquisition of
certain television station non-license assets.&#160;
We analyze specific definite-lived intangibles for impairment when
events occur that may impact their value.&#160;
The following table shows the gross carrying amount and accumulated
amortization of intangibles and estimated amortization related to continuing
operations (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Network
  affiliation</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15-25 years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.24%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The amortization
expense of the definite-lived intangible assets and other assets for the years
ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 was $18.0 million, $18.5 million and
$18.8 million, respectively.&#160; The
following table shows the estimated amortization expense of the definite-lived
intangible assets and other assets for the next five years (in thousands):</font></p>
