<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31, 2005 and
2004, we had outstanding letters of credit of $1.1 million and $0.9 million,
respectively, under our revolving credit facility.&#160; The letters of credit act as a guarantee of
lease payments for the property occupied by WTTA-TV in Tampa, Florida, pursuant
to the terms and conditions of the lease agreement and as support of the
purchase of the license assets of WNYS-TV in Syracuse, New York, pursuant to an
Asset Purchase Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Network Affiliation Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Of the 58 television
stations that we own and operate, or to which we provide programming services
or sales services, 56 currently operate as affiliates of FOX (19 stations), WB
(18 stations), ABC (10 stations), UPN (6 stations), CBS (2 stations) and NBC (1
station).&#160;&#160; The remaining two stations
are independent.&#160; The networks produce
and distribute programming in exchange for each station&#146;s commitment to air the
programming at specified times and for commercial announcement time during
programming.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The affiliation
agreements of five ABC stations (WSYX-TV in Columbus, Ohio; WLOS-TV in
Asheville, North Carolina; WCHS-TV in Charleston, West Virginia; WEAR-TV in
Pensacola, Florida and WGGB-TV in Springfield, Massachusetts) expired on or
before January 31, 2005.&#160; During June
2005, we entered into a binding term sheet with ABC to renew all of our ABC
affiliation agreements effective as of January 1, 2005.&#160; In September 2005, WICS-TV and WICD-TV in
Springfield/Champaign, Illinois switched from NBC to ABC affiliates.&#160; The net aggregate book value of our ABC
affiliate agreements was $105.5 million as of December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June 30, 2005, the
affiliation agreements for our FOX affiliates expired.&#160; On August 22, 2005, we entered into an
agreement that caused these expired agreements to continue in full force and
effect until terminated by either party.&#160;
We are currently in negotiations to renew the FOX affiliation agreements
on a long-term basis.&#160; At this time, we
cannot predict the final outcome of these negotiations and any impact they may
have on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated statements of operations
or consolidated statements of cash flows.&#160;
As of December 31, 2005, the aggregate net book value of these
affiliation agreements was $37.3 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 24, 2005, NBC
informed us that they intend to terminate our affiliation with WTWC-TV in
Tallahassee, Florida.&#160; This notice is
contractually required to avoid automatic renewal of the existing agreement
which expires January 1, 2007.&#160; NBC has
stated it is willing to continue its affiliation with WTWC if revised terms and
conditions can be agreed upon.&#160; As of
December 31, 2005, the net book value of this affiliation agreement was $2.3
million.&#160; We plan to enter into
negotiations with NBC regarding our affiliation agreement and, at this time, we
cannot predict the final outcome of these negotiations and any impact they may
have on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated statements of operations
or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January 24, 2006, CBS
Corporation (CBS) and Warner Bros. Entertainment (Warner Bros.) announced their
intent to merge the operations of their respective networks, UPN and The WB,
into a broadcasting network to be called The CW Television Network (The
CW).&#160; On March 2, 2006, we announced that
we agreed with Twentieth Television, Inc. to air MyNetworkTV primetime
programming on 17 of our stations.&#160; At
this time, we cannot predict which of our remaining stations will be affiliated
with The CW, nor can we predict whether CBS or Warner Bros. will honor certain
agreements, including affiliation agreements, that were made with us in the
past.&#160; The aggregate net book value of
our UPN and WB affiliation agreements was $9.0 million as of December 31,
2005.&#160; Refer to our <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Markets and
Stations </font></i>table on page 5 and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note 18.</font></i>  <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Subsequent Events, </font></i>in the Notes to our Consolidated
Financial Statements for additional information regarding these announcements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-30</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-30',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The non-renewal or
termination of any of our other network affiliation agreements would prevent us
from being able to carry programming of the relevant network.&#160; This loss of programming would require us to
obtain replacement programming, which may involve higher costs and which may
not be as attractive to our target audiences, resulting in reduced
revenues.&#160; Upon the termination of any of
the above affiliation agreements, we would be required to establish a new
affiliation agreement with another network or operate as an independent
station.&#160; At such time, the remaining
value of the network affiliation asset could become impaired and we would be
required to write down the value of the asset.&#160;
At this time, we cannot predict the final outcome of these negotiations
and what impact, if any, they may have on our consolidated balance sheets,
consolidated statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Changes in the Rules on Television
Ownership and Local Marketing Agreements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of our stations
have entered into what have commonly been referred to as local marketing
agreements or LMAs.&#160; One typical type of
LMA is a programming agreement between two separately owned television stations
serving the same market, whereby the licensee of one station programs
substantial portions of the broadcast day and sells advertising time during
such programming segments on the other licensee&#146;s station subject to the
ultimate editorial and other controls being exercised by the latter
licensee.&#160; We believe these arrangements
allow us to reduce our operating expenses and enhance profitability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the FCC ownership
rules adopted in 2003, we would be allowed to continue to program most of the
stations with which we have an LMA.&#160; In
the absence of a waiver, the 2003 ownership rules would require us to terminate
or modify three of our LMAs in markets where both the station we own and the
station with which we have an LMA are ranked among the top four stations in their
particular designated market area.&#160; The
FCC&#146;s 2003 ownership rules include specific provisions permitting waivers of
this &#147;top four restriction&#148;.&#160; Although
there can be no assurances, we have studied the application of the 2003
ownership rules to our markets and believe we are qualified for waivers.&#160; The effective date of the 2003 ownership
rules has been stayed by the U. S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit and
the rules are on remand to the FCC.&#160;
Several parties, including us, filed petitions with the Supreme Court of
the United States seeking review of the Third Circuit decision, but the Supreme
Court denied the petitions in June 2005.&#160;
The FCC has not commenced its proceeding on remand.&#160; We cannot predict the outcome of that
proceeding, which could significantly impact our business.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When the FCC decided to
attribute LMAs for ownership purposes in 1999, it grandfathered our LMAs that
were entered into prior to November 5, 1996, permitting the applicable stations
to continue operations pursuant to the LMAs until the conclusion of the FCC&#146;s
2004 biennial review.&#160; The FCC stated it
would conduct a case-by-case review of grandfathered LMAs and assess the
appropriateness of extending the grandfathering periods.&#160; Subsequently, the FCC invited comments as to
whether, instead of beginning the review of the grandfathered LMAs in 2004, it
should do so in 2006.&#160; The FCC has not
initiated any such review of grandfathered LMAs and we cannot predict when the
FCC will do so.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because the effective
date of the 2003 ownership rules has been stayed and, in connection with the
adoption of those rules, the FCC concluded the old rules could not be justified
as necessary to the public interest, we have taken the position that an issue
exists regarding whether the FCC has any current legal right to enforce any
rules prohibiting the acquisition of television stations.&#160; The FCC, however, dismissed our applications
to acquire certain LMA stations.&#160; We
filed an application for review of that decision, which is still pending.&#160; In 2005, we filed a petition with the U. S.
Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit requesting that the Court direct the FCC
to take final action on our applications, but that petition was denied.&#160; We recently submitted a motion to the FCC
requesting that it take final action on our applications and that request is
pending.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November 15, 1999, we
entered into a plan and agreement of merger to acquire through merger WBSC-TV
(formerly WFBC-TV) in Anderson, South Carolina from Cunningham Broadcasting
Corporation (Cunningham), but that transaction was denied by the FCC.&#160; In light of the change in the 2003 ownership
rules, we have filed a petition for reconsideration with the FCC and amended
our application to acquire the license of WBSC-TV.&#160; We also filed applications in November 2003
to acquire the license assets of the remaining five Cunningham stations:
WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio; WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WVAH-TV,
Charleston, West Virginia; WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland; and WTTE-TV, Columbus,
Ohio.&#160; The Rainbow/PUSH Coalition
(Rainbow/PUSH) filed a petition to deny these five applications and to revoke
all of our licenses.&#160; The FCC dismissed
our applications in light of the stay of the 2003 ownership rules and also
denied the Rainbow/PUSH petition.&#160; Rainbow/PUSH
filed a petition for reconsideration of that denial and we filed an application
for review of the dismissal, which may be impacted by the remand of the FCC&#146;s
2003 ownership rules.&#160; In 2005, we filed
a petition with the U. S. Court of Appeals for the D. C. Circuit requesting
that the Court direct the FCC to take final </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-31</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-31',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">action on our
applications, but that petition was dismissed.&#160;
We recently submitted a motion to the FCC requesting that it take final
action on our applications.&#160; Both the
applications and the associated petition to deny are still pending.&#160; We believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition is
without merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If we are required to
terminate or modify our LMAs, our business could be affected in the following
ways:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Losses
on investments</font></i>.&#160; As
part of our LMA arrangements, we own the non-license assets used by the
stations with which we have LMAs.&#160; If
certain of these LMA arrangements are no longer permitted, we would be forced
to sell these assets, restructure our agreements or find another use for
them.&#160; If this happens, the market for
such assets may not be as good as when we purchased them and, therefore, we
cannot be certain that we will recoup our original investments.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Termination
penalties</font></i>.&#160; If the FCC
requires us to modify or terminate existing LMAs before the terms of the LMAs
expire, or under certain circumstances, we elect not to extend the terms of the
LMAs, we may be forced to pay termination penalties under the terms of some of
our LMAs.&#160; Any such termination penalty
could be material.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WNAB Options</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2003, we entered into
option agreements with an unrelated third party to purchase certain license and
non-license television broadcast assets of WNAB-TV in Nashville,
Tennessee.&#160; On March 25, 2005, we
exercised the option agreements to acquire certain license and non-license
assets for $5.0 million and $8.3 million, respectively.&#160; On May 31, 2005, we completed the purchase of
the non-license broadcast assets.&#160; The
closing on the license assets is pending approval by the FCC.&#160;&#160; We paid $4.5 million of the license assets
exercise price on December 23, 2005.&#160; If
the FCC has not granted approval by December 22, 2006, we will be required to
pay the remaining $0.5 million to the unrelated third party.&#160; On August 25, 2005, the Rainbow/PUSH filed a
petition with the FCC to deny the transfer of the WNAB broadcast license to
us.&#160; The FCC is currently in the process
of considering the transfer of the broadcast license and we believe the
Rainbow/PUSH petition has no merit.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined that
WNAB continues to be a variable interest entity (VIE) and that we remain the
primary beneficiary of the variable interest as a result of the terms of our
outsourcing agreement and our purchase option.&#160;
As a result, we continue to consolidate the assets and liabilities of
WNAB at their fair values, which have been adjusted to reflect an appraisal
prepared in connection with the closing of the non-license assets.&#160; Goodwill and FCC license book values were
increased by $5.8 million and $4.2 million, respectively, upon the closing of
the non-license assets in May 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity
Assurance</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 26, 2005, we
entered into a twelve-month limited scope liquidity assurance with Acrodyne
Communications, Inc. (Acrodyne), one of our majority-owned subsidiaries.&#160; Pursuant to this agreement, we will provide
to them sufficient funding to cover any necessary working capital needs through
May 25, 2006 should Acrodyne not be able to provide that funding on its
own.&#160; The exposure to us in this
liquidity assurance cannot be estimated nor can its probability of occurrence
be estimated.&#160; In connection with this
liquidity assurance, we established a $0.5 million line of credit for Acrodyne.&#160; Interest on any unpaid indebtedness will be
calculated on a daily basis at LIBOR plus 225 basis points per annum.&#160; As of December 31, 2005, Acrodyne had
borrowed $0.4 million under this line of credit.&#160; We do not believe the liquidity assurance
will have a material impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated
statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows and,
therefore, we have not recorded any liability related to it.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">David, Frederick, Duncan
and Robert Smith (collectively, the controlling shareholders) are brothers and
hold substantially all of the Class B Common Stock.&#160; During each of the periods presented in the
accompanying consolidated financial statements, we engaged in transactions with
them, their immediate family members and/or entities in which they have
substantial interests (collectively, affiliates).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-32</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

  representing interest</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(14,664</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0.375pt 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="84%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:84.98%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.18%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19,287</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September 30, 1990, we
issued certain notes (the founders&#146; notes) maturing on May 31, 2005, payable to
the late Julian S. Smith and Carolyn C. Smith, our former majority owners and
the parents of our controlling shareholders.&#160;
The founders&#146; notes were issued in consideration for stock redemptions
equal to 72.65% of our then outstanding stock, had principal amounts of $7.5
million and $6.7 million, respectively.&#160;
The founders&#146; notes included stated interest rates of 8.75%, which were
payable annually from October 1990 until October 1992, then payable monthly
commencing April 1993 to December 1996 and then semi-annually thereafter until
maturity.&#160; The effective interest rate
approximated 9.4%.&#160; The founders&#146; notes
were secured by security interests in substantially all of our assets and
subsidiaries and were personally guaranteed by our controlling shareholders.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principal and interest
payments on the founders&#146; notes were payable in various amounts, each April and
October, beginning October 1991 until October 2005, with a balloon payment due
at maturity in the amount of $1.5 million.&#160;
Additionally, monthly interest payments commenced April 1993 and
continued until December 1996.&#160; The
Carolyn C. Smith note was fully paid as of December 31, 2002.&#160; On October 1, 2005, we fully redeemed the
founders&#146; note due to the late Julian S. Smith with a final payment of $1.5
million.&#160; Principal and interest paid on
the Julian S. Smith note was $2.2 million, $1.4 million and $1.5 million for
the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160; At December 31, 2004, $2.0 million of the
Julian S. Smith note remained outstanding.&#160;
At December 31, 2005, the Julian S. Smith note was fully paid.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concurrently with our
initial public offering, we acquired options from trusts established by Carolyn
C. Smith for the benefit of her grandchildren that will grant us the right to
acquire, subject to applicable FCC rules and regulations, 100% of the capital
stock of Cunningham Broadcasting Corporation (Cunningham).&#160; The Cunningham option exercise price is based
on a formula that provides a 10% annual return to Cunningham.&#160; Cunningham is the owner-operator and FCC
licensee of WNUV-TV, Baltimore, Maryland; WRGT-TV, Dayton, Ohio; WVAH-TV,
Charleston, West Virginia; WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WBSC-TV,
Anderson, South Carolina; and WTTE-TV, Columbus, Ohio.&#160; The financial statements for Cunningham are
included in our consolidated financial statements for all periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We entered into five-year
LMA agreements (with five-year renewal terms at our option) with Cunningham
pursuant to which we provide programming to Cunningham for airing on WNUV,
WRGT, WVAH, WTAT, WBSC and WTTE.&#160; During
the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, we made payments of $7.0
million, $5.9 million and $4.7 million, respectively, to Cunningham under these
LMA agreements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cunningham accounts for
income taxes and deferred taxes using the separate return method and those
amounts are consolidated into our income taxes and deferred taxes, which are
also calculated using the separate return method.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004
and 2003, Cunningham&#146;s provision for income taxes was $0.7 million, $0.5
million and $1.5 million, respectively.&#160;
As of December 31, 2005 and 2004, Cunningham&#146;s deferred tax assets were
$1.7 million and $2.2 million, respectively and Cunningham&#146;s deferred tax
liabilities were $3.8 million and $3.2 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, we
have entered into charter arrangements to lease aircraft owned by certain
controlling shareholders.&#160; During 2005, we
incurred less than $0.1 million related to these arrangements.&#160; During the years ended December 31, 2004 and
2003, we incurred expenses of approximately $0.1 million and $0.2 million
related to these arrangements, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain assets used by us
and our operating subsidiaries are leased from Cunningham Communications Inc.,
Keyser Investment Group, Gerstell Development Limited Partnership and Beaver
Dam, LLC (entities owned by the controlling shareholders).&#160; Lease payments made to these entities were
$4.5 million, $4.3 million and $4.1 million for the years ended</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-34</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-34',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">December
31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 1999,
we entered into a LMA with Bay Television, Inc. (Bay TV), which owns the
television station WTTA-TV in Tampa, Florida.&#160;
Our controlling shareholders own a substantial portion of the equity of
Bay TV.&#160; The LMA provides that we deliver
television programming to Bay TV, which broadcasts the programming in return
for a monthly fee to Bay TV of $143,500.&#160;
We must also make an annual payment equal to 50% of the adjusted annual
broadcast cash flow of the station (as defined in the LMA) which is in excess
of $1.7 million.&#160; The additional payment
is reduced by 50% of the adjusted broadcast cash flow of the station that was
below zero in prior calendar years.&#160;
Lease payments made to Bay TV were $2.1 million, $1.7 million and $1.7
million for the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.&#160; An additional payment of
$0.3 million was made in 2005 and $32,000 was made in 2004 related to the
adjusted broadcast cash flow of the station that exceeded $1.7 million for the
years ended December 31, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with
our 1997 negotiations with The WB to obtain affiliation agreements for a number
of our stations, we discussed an opportunity to obtain The WB affiliation in
Tampa, Florida for WTTA-TV, which is owned by Bay TV as described above.&#160; We did this in anticipation of entering into
a LMA with Bay TV to program WTTA, which was then operating as a non-affiliated
independent television station airing paid programming.&#160; In 1998, in order to obtain The WB
affiliation for WTTA, we and Bay TV each agreed to make payments in the future
to The WB of $10.0 million, or $20.0 million in total.&#160; Our agreement to make such payment was
conditioned upon Bay TV entering into the aforementioned LMA agreement, which
we subsequently entered into in January 1999.&#160;
Our obligation to make a $10.0 million payment to The WB was structured
as a $5.0 million reduction of each of the payments owed to us by The WB under
our multi-station affiliation agreement in January of each of 2006 and 2007,
assuming that The WB was still operating a television network at the time such
payments were due.&#160; Additionally, Bay TV
agreed to make $5.0 million cash payments to The WB in January 2006 and January
2007 pursuant to the granting of The WB affiliation for WTTA.&#160; Additionally, our multi-station WB
affiliation agreement provides that The WB&#146;s obligation to make a $5.0 million
payment to us in each of January 2006 and 2007 is expressly conditioned upon
receipt by The WB of corresponding payments from Bay TV.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After Bay TV
failed to make its first $5.0 million payment to The WB on its due date January
16, 2006, The WB withheld $5.0 million from the amount due to us pursuant to
our multi-station affiliation agreement.&#160;
On January 24, 2006, The WB announced that it was combining with the UPN
television network to form The CW television network and that a station owned
by CBS in Tampa will become The CW affiliate.&#160;
</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are currently
engaged in negotiations with The WB regarding a number of issues surrounding
their recent announcement, including the impact of the elimination of WTTA&#146;s WB
network affiliation and the amount we and Bay TV agreed to pay for the affiliation
in Tampa.&#160; Depending on the result of
these negotiations we may take a variety of actions, including requesting that
The WB either pay us the full amount which was due on January 16, 2006, or
assign to us any rights to enforce payment by Bay TV so that we may initiate
appropriate action directly.&#160; We are
currently engaged in negotiations with Bay TV regarding payment terms and
certain other provisions of our LMA agreement. </font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 2, 2006, we
announced that we entered into an agreement with MyNetworkTV, a division of
Twentieth Television, Inc. that will provide original programming from 8:00pm
to 10:00pm (EST/PST) Monday through Saturday beginning on September 5,
2006.&#160; This agreement relates to 17 of
our stations, including WTTA.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 30, 2002, we
invested $20.0 million in Atlantic Automotive Corporation (&#147;Atlantic
Automotive&#148;, formerly Summa Holdings, Ltd.) resulting in a 17.5% equity
interest.&#160; Atlantic Automotive is a
holding company which owns automobile dealerships and a leasing company.&#160; David D. Smith, our President and Chief
Executive Officer, has a controlling interest in Atlantic Automotive and is a
member of the Board of Directors.&#160; We
have significant influence by holding a board seat (in addition to the board
seat held personally by David D. Smith); therefore, we account for this
investment under the equity method of accounting.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 31, 2005, we
entered into an agreement with Auto Properties LLC, an affiliate of Atlantic
Automotive to sell our 17.5% equity interest, or 21.22 shares, in Atlantic
Automotive to Auto Properties LLC for approximately $21.5 million in cash.&#160; On August 2, 2005, the agreement between us
and Auto Properties LLC was nullified and we entered into new stock purchase
agreements with David D. Smith and Steven B. Fader, an unrelated third party,
and entered into a stock redemption agreement with Atlantic Automotive,
totaling approximately $21.5 million.&#160;
Pursuant to the stock purchase agreements, on August 2, 2005, 9.87
shares were sold to each party for $10.0 million in cash and pursuant to the
stock redemption agreements, Atlantic Automotive redeemed the remaining 1.48
shares of our equity interest for $1.5 million in cash.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August 1999, we
established a small business investment company called Allegiance Capital
Limited Partnership (Allegiance) with an investment of $2.4 million.&#160; Our controlling shareholders and our Chief
Financial Officer and Executive Vice President are also limited partners in
Allegiance, along with Allegiance Capital Management Corporation (ACMC), the
general partner.&#160; ACMC controls all
decision making, investing and management of operations of Allegiance in
exchange for a monthly management fee based on actual expenses incurred which
currently averages approximately $40,800 and which is paid by the limited
partners.&#160; We have invested $10.4 million
as of December 31, 2005 and we are, together with the other limited partners,
committed to investing up to a combined total of $15.0 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July 1, 2005, Sinclair
Communications, LLC (Sinclair Communications), a subsidiary of Sinclair
Broadcast Group, Inc. (SBG), and Cunningham Communications, Inc. (Cunningham
Communications) entered into Amendment No. 2 (the Amendment) to an original
Lease Agreement (the Lease), dated July 1, 1987, as amended July 1, 1997.&#160; The Amendment allows Sinclair Communications
to lease tower and building space utilized for digital television
transmission.&#160; The Amendment became effective
July 1, 2005 and expires on June 30, 2007.&#160;
Cunningham Communications is owned by David D. Smith, SBG&#146;s President,
Chief Executive Officer and Director, as well as Frederick Smith, J. Duncan
Smith and Robert Smith, members of SBG&#146;s Board of Directors and the controlling
shareholders of SBG.&#160; The Lease was
amended to increase the monthly rent by $25,357 for a total current monthly
rent of $82,860.&#160; The monthly rent will
increase by the greater of 5% or the Consumer Price Index for Inflation in July
of 2006.&#160; In addition, on July 1, 2005,
Sinclair Communications made a lump sum payment of $565,800 to Cunningham
Communications as a requirement of the Amendment upon execution.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In response to the
disaster caused by hurricane Katrina, the Sinclair Relief Fund (the Fund) was
formed by David D. Smith, Frederick Smith, J. Duncan Smith and Barry M. Faber,
our Vice President and General Counsel.&#160;
The Fund is a qualified charitable organization formed to provide
monetary aid and relief to the victims of natural disasters.&#160; On September 21, 2005, we made a $50,000
contribution to the Fund.&#160; This
contribution was authorized by the Audit Committee.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-35</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-35',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with SFAS
144, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for the Impairment or
Disposal of Long-Lived Assets</font></i>, we reported the financial position
and results of operations for WEMT-TV, KOVR-TV and KSMO-TV as discontinued
operations in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets and consolidated
statements of operations.&#160; Discontinued
operations have not been segregated in the consolidated statements of cash
flows and, therefore, amounts for certain captions will not agree with the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements of
operations.&#160; The operating results of
WEMT, KOVR and KSMO are not included in our consolidated results from
continuing operations for the years ended December 31, 2005, 2004 and
2003.&#160; In accordance with EITF No. 87-24,
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Allocation of Interest to Discontinued
Operations</font></i>, we have allocated $3.6 million, $7.7 million and $6.8
million of interest expense to discontinued operations for the years ended
December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.&#160;
Since we continue to own the rights to collect the amounts due to us
through the closing dates of the non-license television broadcast assets, accounts
receivable related to all of our discontinued operations is included in the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets, net of allowance for doubtful
accounts, for all periods presented.&#160;
Such amounts were $0.2 million (net of allowance of $0.4 million) and
$9.8 million (net of allowance of $0.4 million) as of December 31, 2005 and
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WEMT Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 16, 2005, we
entered into an agreement to sell WEMT-TV in Tri-Cities, Tennessee, including
the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) license (the broadcast license) to
an unrelated third party for $7.0 million.&#160;
On the same day, we completed the sale of the WEMT non-license
television broadcast assets for $5.6 million of the total $7.0 million sale
price and recorded a deferred gain of $3.2 million, which is stated separately
on the consolidated balance sheets.&#160; We
operated WEMT under a joint sales agreement until the closing of the broadcast
license on February 8, 2006.&#160; Net assets
and liabilities held for sale related to WEMT were $1.9 million and $4.5
million as of December 31, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; The net cash proceeds will be used in the
normal course of operations and for capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">KOVR Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 2, 2004, we
entered into an agreement to sell KOVR-TV in Sacramento, California, including
the FCC license and our investment in KOVR Joint Venture (collectively KOVR) to
an unrelated third party.&#160; The FCC
approved the transfer of the license to the unrelated third party and we
completed the sale on April 29, 2005 for a cash purchase price of $285.0
million.&#160; We recorded a gain of $129.5
million, net of $70.0 million of taxes, as a gain from discontinued operations
in our consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December 31,
2005.&#160; The net proceeds were used to
repay bank debt.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">KSMO Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November 12, 2004, we
entered into an agreement to sell KSMO-TV in Kansas City, Missouri, including
the FCC license (KSMO broadcast license) to an unrelated third party for $33.5
million.&#160; On the same day, we completed
the sale of the KSMO non-license television broadcast assets for $26.8 million
of the total $33.5 million sale price.&#160;
The FCC approved the transfer of the broadcast license to the unrelated
third party and we completed the sale of the license assets, including the
broadcast license, on September 29, 2005 for a cash price of approximately $6.7
million.&#160; We recorded $16.5 million, net
of $10.0 million in taxes, as gain from discontinued operations in our
consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December 31,
2005.&#160; The gain is comprised of the
previously deferred gain of $26.1 million and the gain of $0.4 million from the
sale of the license assets, net of taxes, respectively.&#160; The net cash proceeds were used in the normal
course of operations and for capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Dispositions</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2003, we reduced
our long-term liabilities related to accruals of&#160; $1.6 million as a result of the expiration of
certain statutes of limitations related to the sale of radio stations in prior
years.&#160; This adjustment was recorded in
discontinued operations.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-36</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-36',FILE='C:\JMS\ksendil\06-1921-1\task933040\1921-1-ba-07.htm',USER='sksivasankaran',CD='Mar 17 02:28 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Sinclair Broadcast
Group, Inc. 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan and Trust (the 401(k) Plan) covers our
eligible employees.&#160; Contributions made
to the 401(k) Plan include an employee elected salary reduction amount,
company-matching contributions and an additional discretionary amount
determined each year by the Board of Directors.&#160;
Our 401(k) Plan expense from continuing operations for the years ended
December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 was $1.6 million, $1.5 million and $1.3
million, respectively.&#160; There were no
additional discretionary contributions during these periods.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>STOCK BASED COMPENSATION PLANS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock Option Plans</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Incentive
Stock Option Plan</font></i>.&#160; In
connection with our initial public offering in June 1995, our Board of
Directors adopted an Incentive Stock Option Plan (ISOP) pursuant to which
options for shares of Class A Common Stock may be granted to certain
employees.&#160; The number of shares of Class
A Common Stock reserved for issuance under the ISOP was 800,000.&#160; In June 1996, the Board of Directors adopted,
upon approval of the shareholders by proxy, an amendment to our ISOP.&#160; The purpose of the amendment was (i) to
increase the number of shares of Class A Common Stock approved for issuance
under the plan from 800,000 to 1,000,000, (ii) to lengthen the period after
date of grant before options become exercisable from two years to three years
and (iii) to provide immediate termination and three-year ratable vesting of
options in certain circumstances.&#160;
Options granted pursuant to the ISOP must be exercised within 10 years
following the grant date.&#160; As of December
31, 2005, 714,200 shares have been granted under the ISOP and no shares
(including forfeited shares) were available for future grants because the ISOP
expired in June 2005, the tenth anniversary of the ISOP.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Designated
Participants Stock Option Plan</font></i>.&#160; In connection with our initial public
offering in June 1995, our Board of Directors adopted an Incentive Stock Option
Plan for Designated Participants (Designated Participants Stock Option Plan)
pursuant to which options for shares of Class A Common Stock were granted to
certain of our key employees.&#160; The
Designated Participants Stock Option Plan provides that the number of shares of
Class A Common Stock reserved for issuance under that plan is 136,000.&#160; Options granted pursuant to Designated
Participants Stock Option Plan must be exercised within 10 years following the
grant date.&#160; As of December 31, 2005, no
shares were available for future grants because the Plan expired in June 2005,
the tenth anniversary date of the Plan.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Long-Term
Incentive Plan</font></i>.&#160; In
June 1996, our Board of Directors adopted, upon approval of the shareholders by
proxy, the 1996 Long-Term Incentive Plans (LTIP).&#160; The purpose of the LTIP is to reward key
individuals for making major contributions to our success and that of our
subsidiaries and to attract and retain the services of qualified and capable
employees.&#160; Options granted pursuant to
the LTIP must be exercised within 10 years following the grant date.&#160; A total of 14,000,000 shares of Class A
Common Stock are reserved for awards under this plan.&#160; As of December 31, 2005, 7,020,114 shares
(including forfeited shares) were available for future grants.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April 21, 2005, we
accelerated the vesting of all unvested options held by employees, executive
officers and non-employee directors.&#160; As
a result of the accelerated vesting, options to purchase approximately 400,000
shares became immediately exercisable.&#160;
The acceleration of the vesting resulted in a modification to the
original options.&#160; In accordance with
FASB Interpretation No. 44<i><font style="font-style:italic;">, Accounting for Certain
Transactions Involving Stock Based Compensation</font></i>, we recorded an
immaterial compensation charge based on the intrinsic value of the awards (as
defined by the Interpretation) as measured on the modification date.&#160; The exercise prices of these options range from
$7.39 to $15.19 per share and there was no material impact to earnings as a
result of this acceleration because most options had an exercise price that was
above the trading price on the vesting date.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-37</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years ended
December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, we applied the treasury stock method to
measure the dilutive effect of our outstanding stock options and included the
respective common share equivalents in the denominator of the diluted EPS
computation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years ended
December 31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, our Convertible Debentures (formerly
Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock) and Convertible Senior Notes were
anti-dilutive, and were not included in the computation of diluted EPS.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>CONDENSED CONSOLIDATING FINANCIAL
STATEMENTS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sinclair Television
Group, Inc. (STG) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group,
Inc. (SBG) and was incorporated in 2003.&#160;
On September 30, 2003, we completed the creation of a modified holding
company structure, whereby we transferred substantially all of our television
broadcast assets and liabilities to STG.&#160;
As such, STG has become the primary obligor under our Bank Credit
Agreement, the 8.75% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2011 and the 8% Senior
Subordinated Notes, due 2012.&#160; Our Class
A Common Stock, Class B Common Stock, 6% Convertible Debentures, due 2012 and
the 4.875% Convertible Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2018 remain at SBG and
are neither obligations nor securities of STG.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SBG and KDSM, LLC, a
wholly-owned subsidiary of SBG, have fully and unconditionally guaranteed all
of STG&#146;s obligations.&#160; Those guarantees
are joint and several.&#160; There are no
significant restrictions on the ability of SBG, STG or KDSM, LLC to obtain
funds from their subsidiaries in the form of dividends or loans.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following condensed
consolidating financial statements present the financial position, results of
operations and cash flows of SBG, STG, KDSM, LLC, the direct and indirect
non-guarantor subsidiaries of SBG and the eliminations necessary to arrive at
our information on a consolidated basis.&#160;
These statements are presented in accordance with the disclosure
requirements under Securities and Exchange Commission Regulation S-X, Rule
3-10.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-39</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED BALANCE SHEET</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2005</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in thousands)</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  liabilities and shareholders&#146; equity</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PRO FORMA CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED
STATEMENT OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED STATEMENT OF
CASH FLOWS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2005</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in thousands)</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED STATEMENT OF
CASH FLOWS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2004</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in thousands)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PRO FORMA CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED
STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2003</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Results previously
reported in our Form 10-Q&#146;s for 2005 and 2004 and our Form 10-K, as amended, for
the year ended December 31, 2004, have been restated to reflect discontinued
operations related to the sale of WEMT-TV in Tri-Cities, Tennessee.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-47</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</u>:</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Related
Party Disclosure</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After Bay TV
failed to make its first $5.0 million payment to The WB on its due date January
16, 2006, The WB withheld $5.0 million from the amount due to us pursuant to
our multi-station affiliation agreement.&#160;
For more information see <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note. 11 Related Party
Transactions</font></i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The CW Network</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January 24,
2006, CBS Corporation (CBS) and Warner Bros. Entertainment (Warner Bros.)
announced their intent to merge the operations of their respective networks,
UPN and The WB, under a broadcasting network to be called The CW.&#160; At the same time, it was announced that
certain television stations owned by Tribune Broadcasting and CBS would enter
into affiliation agreements with The CW.&#160;
Although CBS and Warner Bros. have taken the position that this event
will constitute the cessation of operations for both the WB and UPN television
networks, we have notified both CBS and Warner Bros. that we have questions
about whether their plans actually constitute either or both networks ceasing
operations and have reserved all rights that we may have to continue as their
affiliates in certain markets in the event they are not deemed to have ceased
operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have not
received termination notices from CBS or Warner Bros., although we have been
contacted by them regarding the future operations of the UPN and WB
networks.&#160; At this time, we cannot
predict which of our stations will be affiliated with The CW, nor can we
predict whether CBS or Warner Bros. will honor certain agreements, including affiliation
agreements, that were made with us in the past.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WEMT Disposition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We operated WEMT-TV in Tri-Cities, Tennessee
under a joint sales agreement until the closing on the sale of the broadcast
license on February 8, 2006.&#160; For more
information related to the sale of WEMT, see <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Note
12. Discontinued Operations</font></i>.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">WTXL Termination</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February 19, 2006, we terminated our
outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third party owner of WTXL-TV in Tallahassee,
Florida.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">MyNetworkTV</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 2, 2006, we announced that we entered
into an agreement with MyNetworkTV, a division of Twentieth Television, Inc.
that will provide original programming from 8:00pm to 10:00pm (EST/PST) Monday
through Saturday beginning on September 5, 2006.&#160; This agreement impacts 17 of our stations,
including 10 stations affiliated with The WB, all six of our UPN affiliates and
one of our independent stations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The net book value of the network affiliation
agreements related to our WB and UPN stations that will be airing MyNetworkTV
programming was $6.3 million as of December 31, 2005.&#160; The net book value of the network affiliation
agreements related to our remaining eight WB stations was $2.7 million as of
December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-48</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left"></div>

</div>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">
